Although I loved how I could charge the case while using them so I only rarely had to not use them I was very disappointed how quickly they would start to break on me. After only a few months my left ear bud stopped connecting consistently to the point that I'm just using 1 earphone till I get a new set of headphones. Would rate 5/5 if they didn't die because of how cheap and reliable they were.

title: Read the Instructions First And You Will Love These
body:
These are excellent quality wireless ear buds. When I got them, I also got the extended warranty. It comes as a card with them so you just use a QR scanner. It takes you to the website to complete it.
I noticed that the box was packed very well and contained several sizes of the rubber inserts in case you’re like me and have small ear canals.
When I first started to put them in my ears, I had to refer to the instructions to make sure I knew how to connect them by Bluetooth.
When you pull them out of the docking station, you just put the right ear in first then the left.
They are very much like my hearing aids, but the musical sound seems much better.
Because I’m hearing impaired, I needed something so I could listen without hearing outside noise. Thanks for such an amazing product.

title: Excellent Sound!
body: These earbuds are wonderful. I picked them based on the reviews, and I was not disappointed. The Bluetooth pairing with my iPhone was fast and easy, and there is an excellent range as well - I can leave my phone anywhere in my apartment and walk around and the sound never cuts out. The battery life is pretty impressive too. I can get about 3-4 hours on a full charge and they re-charge super fast as well. The charging case is a nice touch, and is good for recharging the earbuds about three times. Most importantly, they sound really good. I was so happy with these that I recommended them to my mother and she also loves them. Would buy again in an instant.

title: Pleasantly surprised
body: So when o bought these I wasn’t expecting a lot being the price being so cheap for wireless earbuds but the are hands down some of the best earbuds I’ve had they sound great have good bass fit pretty snug and comfortable. They cancel out a lot of noise too had someone banging on the door the other day and couldn’t hear them 🤷🏻‍♂️ They also have great Bluetooth range and a great battery life I would definitely recommend getting these earbuds great buy

title: Great Headphones!
body:
I bought these headphones because I previously had bluetooth headphones that had a small wire connecting the two earbuds together. I finally decided to just go all in and buy true wireless bluetooth headphones and I bought these because they were bass-boosted and had a fair price in my opinion. The carrying case charges the earphones when you're not using them and doesn't have to be plugged in to charge.

Pros:
+Good Volume
+Good Sizing (Comes with different earbud sizes for your own personal fitting)
+Bass-Boosted
+Last ~4+ Hours on One Charge
+Easy to pair
+Waterproof

Cons:
-No Volume Control
-No Skipping Music Tracks (Only Pause)

title: WORSE EARBUDS EVER!!! Don’t waste your money!
body: These were the WORST earbuds I’ve ever gotten! They lost connection with each other ever 5 seconds (i was just sitting in my room, let’s not talk how bad they were when I went for a walk). The bass is WAY over powering were it masked over the mids to the point were you don’t even hear the mids. The highs was turn to high as well were it just hurt your hearing if you turned the volume slightly to high. And to top it off the customer service is horrible. WORSE EARBUDS EVER!!!

title: not for normal ears
body: it was good for the 2 minutes it would stay in my ear. I replaced a similar product by Mpow. so I now how to put these in my ear but these would not stay.

title: Powebeats 3 vs. TOZA T10
body:
I purchased my Powerbeats 3  8 months ago.  One they are not wireless but I did not mind.  They are usually $199 but Best buy was having a special and I got them for $100.  The sound quality was okay and they were fine for what it was.  A couple days ago one of the plastic ear hooks broke at the base of it and I took it back to Best Buy who told me it was still under warranty but that I would have to take it to an Apple store because they deal with the warranty stuff.
I took it to the Apple store and they said that it was "physical" damage and that they couldnt replace it or give me credit for it.
I considered upgrading to the wireless beats for $299 but after no credit was offered for clearly cheap rubber ear hooks I decided to look on Amazon for an alternative.
I found the T10's.  Ordered them in the Apple store after sampling the new wireless beats.  I got them today.  For 1/4 of the price these things sound just as good as the beats if not better.  Do yourself a favor and get these things if you are looking dor wireless headphones.  For the price these are definately a buy.

title: BEST bang for your buck for wireless buds!
body: Was pleasantly surprised when I received these yesterday and tried them out for the first time...the sound quality is GREAT! My favorite feature is the noise cancelling, you can immediately feel the quality on them once you put them on. My wife was on the verge of buying a more expensive brand of earbuds, but once she checked out mine she immediately changed her mind. She's getting the same pair! :) One of my wisest purchases!!

title: I love these but there is one thing I hate.
body:
I bought these honestly because of the price and the amount of reviews,  but I'm happy.  I love how the work there simple.  Just take them out of box and put in ears and they pair automatically.  I also love how they turn off as soon as I put them in box to charge.  Everything is laid out perfectly and the sound quality is as good as it gets.  They could be a bit louder but I downloaded an EQ booster to fix that minor issue.  They're plenty loud for most people but I listen to screamo music and I like it to loud as heck.

One other thing I would like to add I like is the comfort.  These stayed in my ears without issue while riding a bike,  stairclimbing,  and running .. No issues whatsoever.  I have small ear canals so I used the smallest ear foam and they stayed put.  Just make sure you twist them so they're sitting properly in ear.

The one thing I hate about these is the inability to skip songs and raise and lower the volume from buds.  I have bluetooth earbuds from 5 years ago that can do this so this frustrates me.  I guess I could send them back but I'm not going to because I like how they look and sound so much.  If you don't have a need for skipping songs and turning up and down from the buds then your golden.

title: Great for heavy use by university students
body:
I love these earbuds. I'd recommend them to anybody who is looking for solid sound quality and noise cancellation but prioritizes durability for heavy use (such as university students like myself).

Recently my Jaybirds died on me; I had used them for 3+ years for listening to music when I walk to class and exercise, cancel out noise when I sleep, and make calls. I was looking for something that could last me a while at this level of heavy use while providing good noise cancellation and decent quality.

When I got these I was immediately very pleased. I have very weird ears that most Apple products and other ears buds don't fit. These fit great, stayed in, and were hardly noticeable. The pairing process was also very easy.

The sound quality and noise cancellation is good and easily comparable to my $100+ wired Jaybirds. The call quality is decent but nothing to write home about. It won't blow your mind or anything but it is definitely more than sufficient for me.

I've used them for close to a month constantly and have had no problems. I am especially impressed with the battery. I charge the case at night and wear the earbuds when I sleep. When I set Spotify to a 30 minute sleep timer there is still plenty of battery to get me through my morning walk to class. I rarely use the whole case charge in 1 day, even with 2/3 hours of intermittent use.

I also love how they are water proof, something that I did not have previously with my Jaybirds. When I shower in the dorms late at night sometimes I don't want to play my music out loud publicly, and these have worked great in the shower directly in water.

My only nitpicks would be that there is no skip song button, extreme extended use can hurt your ears, and the volume doesn't go that low. The skip song button is not a huge deal, it just means having your phone accessible if skipping songs is something you do. When I sleep I like to put the earbuds on min volume, which on these is significantly louder than on my Jaybirds. With that said, so far it hasn't hindered my sleep. Additionally I think I slept on my right ear one night and developed a blister on the back of my ear. To be fair, I wear these things up to 10 hours a day, and I don't think there is a single design out there that would not hurt after THAT much time. Plus I just slept without them for a day or two and I was back to normal. So if those issues don't sound major to you, I see no reason why you shouldn't get these.

title: Everything is amazing! Price, sound and company!
body: Wow! These earbuds are amazing. The sound quality and noise cancellation are like no other earbuds I’ve had before. Plus they have different sizes to fit your ear. After about 6 months my earbuds stopped working and I emailed the customer service, they are so awesome. They are sending me another pair for free!! The quality of the earbuds and customer service are unmatched for the price!

title: Very comfortable & perfect for the office or workout
body: Purchased these for the ‘open office environment’ and love them! Fitting them snug in the ear creates noise dampening and with music on, or listening to a podcast, that’s all I hear. The sound is incredible..love the bass..but sound quality is dependent upon how tight the buds are sitting in the ear. These are the most comfortable ear buds I’ve worn and the charge is lasting through the day. I’m impressed and very pleased with this purchase and highly recommend. I didn’t rate the moisture wicking as I’ve no experience with these buds in that area.

title: Customer Service is On Par!
body: I really like these headphones. They are loud, comfortable, and do great during my water aerobics classes. They even charge wireless, which I love. Unfortunately one of them stopped working and I thought I wasted my money. But such is NOT the case! Their customer service has been very responsive and they stand behind their product. They are sending me a new set. Great customer service is hard to come by, but this is a company that has it. Good product! Great service!

title: Best bang for the buck
body: LOve  sound  quality, bass is exceptional for her fraction of the price of leading brands Only thing is I use it for work and I only wear one side at a time Doesn’t automatically connect when not using the primary ear bud . So would have to push the button to switch from L to R ear bud. But it’s super comfortable and light weight to wear all day long . And love the fact that both ear pieces can be worn in either ear. Great quality and loved the packaging it came in.

title: Must buy for the quality and price!
body: These earbuds are amazing! I have done hours of research, and was unable to find a pair of headphones that are truly wireless, water resistant, workout approved, and come with a charging case... Not to mention have great sound with good highs lows and mids for this price point. This is a must buy if you are looking for all of the above in a sub $50 headphone with great sound.

title: Great headphones
body: Headphones work great they have better bass than any other headphones I’ve tried and stay in ear. Wireless charging and auto pairing when taken out of case is great and a lot cheaper than others on market.

title: Great wireless earbuds w/a strong battery
body: I got these for running!  They pair perfectly with my WearOS watch (worn on the right wrist, the left wrist has trouble maintaining connection outdoors due to the receiver being on the right ear), are plenty loud, pair quickly, and are comfortable on long runs.  I don't ever feel like they're going to fall out.  Perfect for working out.  Haven't had any issues with battery life yet either.

title: Excellent little earbuds for the money!
body:
These little buds have a BIG SOUND. Great bass and very clear.
I use them at work for a little music and phone calls. Excellent.

title: Good sound, large size.
body:
They are a lot larger than I expected

They sound very good,  pair up easily The only drawback is they come out easily because of the weight I will look for a medium size foam ear pad to see if they work better.

title: Hmmmm..... Was asked to write a favorable review for free charger plate
body:
I count on reviews on Amazon when deciding what to buy.  I really was bothered to be asked specifically to write a favorable review (not just to write an honest review of my experience) to receive a free charger.  It made me wonder how many of the favorable reviews here were influenced.  I will post my honest opinion .. and NO... I am now not going to even ask for the charger plate.

So I have had a decent experience with these, but they are also the first pair of wireless ear buds I have ever bought and most of the wired ear buds I have bought in the past are less than $10.

So, compared to the really cheap ones I have had, these do definitely dampen sound around me and the sound quality seemed decent to me.  I have problems with them falling out, but if I really jam them in there and twist them against the ear cartilage, I have successfully used them on an elliptical.  Not sure how they would do with more jostling like jogging.

title: Sounds great! Unless your at the GYM
body: These wireless earbuds are good... sounds great and the bass is good too. The only problem that I notice is.. the sound cuts in and out when I’m only at the gym! Weird right? Maybe there is a lot of interference with the equipments at the gym.. I was on the treadmill and then moved to different machines and the music keeps cutting in and out. When I started walking away from the machines and into the locker room and sauna the sound was perfect no cutting in and out at all. I would still recommend

title: Amazingly clear sound
body: I have been using these earbuds for about a month and have taken them on several runs. I like the convenience of not messing with wires. They are easy to use. They immediately pair to each other when taken out of the charging case and then can be paired to the phone. I have an older Moto Z Play phone with Bluetooth 4.0 and have no problems pairing to the earbuds. Sound-wise they are too bright for me having too much treble. But I downloaded Equalizer FX and use it with the Bits MP3 Player and I can adjust the highs and lows exactly the way I like it. Once there I was very impressed with these earbuds.

title: Nice wireless ear buds with great sound
body: Bought these as a gift. The person I gave them to loves them. The different sized buds gave her a perfect fit. Would definately buy again.

title: good headphones
body: these headphones sound great feel great love that they are water proof and come with a 1 year warranty the only problem i have with them is that you cant change the song on the headphones. both ear pieces do the same thing, alot of lost potential in my eyes not having them do opposite things

title: Good headphone can be Great!
body:
I wihs it was a little cheaper or may be I caught it at the pricey end of things in the Amazon world. Over all I am satisfied with the product. I have had it for a few days and am pretty happy with the form factor. My ear plugs are the ones that came fitted on the ear buds out of the box so I havent tried out the smaller one which I should. Over all battery life is pretty spot on 3.5 hrs it doesnt take too long to charge. I have not tested how long it takes to do a full charge but it should be a whole lot.
In terms of missing features or not so great features: The micro phone is not really great could have been definitely better for the price I have paid $50.00 and there seems to be NO volume control on the device itself atleast i could not find any. Call receiving is a little hard since you have to press down on the device which can hurt your ear a little.
Over all its a great device design needs more thought.

title: Waterproof & Wireless
body: I like that there aren’t any wires to worry with or have to break like my Bose that only lasted 1 1/2 years.  These fit nicely in the ear.  I have very small ear canals and I use the smallest bud.  I do have trouble with it fitting in my right ear because my canal is super small and crooked so the noise cancelling isn’t quite up to par for me.  The sound is good but a little tinny.  I would like to see an app to control the volume and bass.  I’m loving that these are waterproof as I run everyday rain or shine.  I give these a thumbs up especially for the price.

title: DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU EXPECT A GOOD SOUND QUALITY
body:
THE TRUTH FOR SAVING MONEY BUY THIS PRODUCT,
I THINK IT WAS TO BE A GOOD PRODUCT WITH EXCELLENT SOUND QUALITY DUE TO ALL THE POSITIVE REVIEWS THAT I LOOK BUT THE REALITY IS OTHER ONER, PRODUCT HAVE TERRIBLE SOUND QUALITY AND CONSTANTLY COMES OUT OF THE EAR. DO NOT BUY THIS THING, DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY AND DOT PAY ATTENTION TO THE POSITIVE REVIEWS . !!!!!

title: Recommend
body:
I love these earbuds. I use them at work and they are charged every night. They have great sound and cancel out other noise. These earbuds are so comfortable, other brands hurt my ears.

The only downfall is the battery life. I do not feel like the battery life is very long at all. I feel like I may only get like 2 to 3 hours of listening out of them before needing to charge.

title: Not for side sleepers
body: Bought these headphones to take on a trip because my travel partner snores.  They are not comfortable for a side sleeper to use. Battery started to beep after about 4 hours of sleep.  So for the purpose I bought them for not the best. But, I love them to wear for all my other activities house cleaning, exercising, drowning out my travel companion's snoring while on a flight. Lol!  Love that they are water proof so if it starts to rain on my walk I'm good. Also enjoy that the box has enough power to charge headphones 4 times.  I feel like I spend less time hooked to an outlet.

title: Great Earbuds for the Price
body: I’ve been using Beats earbuds for a few years now and they started to wear out on me so I decided to get a new pair of wireless earbuds. I was skeptical at first because I got such great sound quality with my Beats and surprisingly these didn’t disappoint me at all. I have small ears so I was nervous that they wouldn’t fit or be uncomfortable but these earbuds fit great and the sound quality is good. I had a little bit of trouble pairing them the first time but figured It out quickly and managed to pair them with my iPhone and MacBook. So far I’m very pleased. I’ll put them to the test at work and see how long the battery life last at a full day of work.

title: Great customer service!
body: I received my order very fast and was very happy with my order. After a few minutes, whenever I moved my head the left earbud would loose connection. I did everything the directions told me to do and no luck. I contacted the seller and they replied very quickly with a few more things to try to fix the problem. Still the same thing kept happening. Within 2 days a new pair arrived at my door and these work great! Great sound, fit, and battery life! I would definitely order from them again, great customer service!

title: Good wireless headphone
body:
I tried them after my Anker were ripped apart by my dog.
I like they support wireless charging so you don't have to plug the case.
Sound quality is good but lacks a little base on low notes. Battery life was good and I never ran into issue. Calling is better and playing PUBG was awesome on ipad. It seamlessly connect with other apple devices at home and I think it is because of Bluetooth 5.0, which now has become standard in industry.

title: I Would Recommend It
body: Overall I would say it is a very good product I haven't tested the water resistance yet however I still recommend it regardless. One of the things I liked most is that it came with a strap for the wireless charger/case and the audio is very clear. The thing I like least is that the material used for the earbud tips hurts my ears a bit because I have very sensitive ears but u can always get replacement tips in a softer material so it isn't a problem.

title: Make sure your ears an fit the ear buds selection.
body: For starters, none of the earbud sizes fit my ears well.  The closest size that works doesn’t work well.  I’m constantly having to push the ear buds back in my ears.  Very annoying during a workout. The sound quality is on the low end.  I like to play a loud volume when I’m working out, these earbuds do not accommodate the volume that I’m used to.  The battery life, ear bud case and the connect process are all great.

title: They’re for hands free phone calls, not wireless music/podcast enjoyment.
body: They seemed pretty great until I realized the only things the buttons do are answer call, hang up, and redial. No volume adjust, no skip forward or rewind. I bought them to listen to music at work, not for making phone calls, and I can barely even do that because the batteries last about 3.5-4 hours before needing to be recharged. If you’re looking for something to make hands free calls with then this product seems like it’s a pretty good choice. If you want them only for listening to music listening then definitely look elsewhere.

title: Great set of buds for a good price
body: I have really enjoyed using these buds. The range on them is quite decent as well. I can leave my phone on my desk and walk around my office without dropping connection. I will say I have had some signal drop once or twice will walking outside however. I believe this is simply due to the radiant transmitters in my office's parking lot though. Overall great set. Wires charging a bonus.

title: Waterproof earbuds with good sound
body:
Just bought these earbuds and am really enjoying them. They stay in very well and block sound well. The music comes through very clearly. They are waterproof, I tested them in the shower and ran the waterproof case under the faucet. I haven’t tested how much they can be submerged since Bluetooth doesn’t work underwater, but you don’t have to worry about accidental splashes.
The Bluetooth between earbuds has enough range to stay connected when you have them in. The buttons control calls and play/pause. You can connect one earbud at a time without continuous beeping if you take them both out first.

title: Great aid while swimming laps.
body: A pleasant surprise how great the Tozo T10 is.  This product was super easy to set up.  Basically plugged it in and when I put it on it immediately hooked up to my iPhone. I use these while swimming laps. Occasionally as I go a little deeper I loose the sound for a bit but it very quickly picks back up and continues without sputter and static as my last headset did.  I love the magnetic snap in when putting the earbuds in to charge. A great deal for the price.

title: Great customer service
body: Sound quality if 100%. They have a long range staying connected to the device, but they can break up and sometimes struggle to connect.

title: Long baterry
body: These buds are awesome.  I can use one at a time or both.  Either the left or thr right will connect.  It connects to multiple devices simultaneously.  Battery life is about 3-5 hrs but the best part is that you place them in the holder and they recharge without attaching them to the outlet.  I can go 4-5 days without charging the whole set.  Only down side it makes a bip sound when its trying to find the other bud.  It doesnt bother me anymore tho.

title: TOZO T10
body: These ear buds are great sound  and battery life is awesome. But try as I did they would not stay in my ears. I used all the different sizes that ca.e with them. I will say my ears have taken a beating over the years from sports. All in all they are a good product. Good luck

title: Everything I ever wanted.
body: So far I’ve experience no issues with my earbuds. The overall product is great, nice sound quality, good bass, and most importantly astonishing battery life if you count your 2-3 extra charges with the included case.  For 1/3 of the price I get more out of my Tozo t10’s than my AirPods. As for working out I’ve had no problems so far, they fit right into my ear like a charm and are almost never loose( except when my ears are wet) overall a great bang for your buck. Would recommend to anyone looking for some tws earbuds with an ip rating of X8.

title: Impressed
body:
I have to admit that even with the reviews I wasn't sure what to expect.  When they arrived I opened the nicely packaged box and thought hmm.  The case is nice and sturdy and I love that the earbuds fit in snugly and the lid snaps closed.

No issues at all pairing with my iPhone or iPad!  The sound quality is great and clear!  The only thing I wish it had that I haven't been able to figure out is how to mute other than using my phone.  This doesn't change my rating since the phone has to be within a certain distance.

VERY happy with my purchase and no wires!  Even better.

title: good for cheap price
body:
Pro: Works good enough for my ~1 hour long runs and was cheap. I only wear when running, and I am content with the product. They stay in perfectly when I'm not sweating ( I wear the largest size earbud covers), and I love the sound quality as well as lack of background noise.

Cons:
--When I run, I strap my phone to my lower back. If I turn my head right/left, the bluetooth cuts out for a few seconds. Thus, if you are a runner who hold your phone in your hand (i.e., not stationary) I imagine you might experience too much cutting out.
--I have to wear the largest size earbud covers, and the earbuds become loose when I begin sweating. When I go on light runs and am not sweating, everything's perfect. When I sweat in a normal run, I have to readjust my left earbud about every 10 min (my right ear tragus is pierced and thus the earbud stays in perfectly). This 10 min adjustment of one ear is not annoying to me, but might be to others.

title: Best cordless ear buds I’ve ever owned!
body:
I’m finally free from the cords!
I love these earbuds. They are the perfect size (small, yet not too small) and the sound they produce is clear from the highs to the deep bass notes.
The single step pairing process is as simple as advertised. You just pick the earpiece up from the charger, and as you insert it into your ear, you will hear it announcing its connecting. That simple!

They hold a great charge and when run down, easily recharge in the charging kit in only an hour or so.
I like these so much I’m going to buy a set for my daughter on her birthday.

title: better than expected.
body: Nice finished quality product. Sound quality is excellent for wireless buds. Best part is that both pieces can work independently. I use one at a time that doubles the battery life. Connect to android via Bluetooth with no problem. Very good value.

title: I had issues but Tozo fixed it.
body:
My first pair, they constantly cut out, re-acquiring the signal every few seconds. When they were new, they constantly re-acquire for the first few minutes of use but would mellows our after like 10,12 min. After awhile they were kinda useless.

Got a second pair from them, issues are gone. Clear sound, no constant beeping Bluetooth re-aquire handshake signal thing.
Inside the box is a Tozo 1 year extended warranty. I strongly suggest using it because a correct working pair is worth this price. And thank you to Tozo PR for reaching out to me in the first place to fix my issues.

title: It does its basic job for the price.
body:
Firstly, make sure to read the manual. For example, you should always connect to the right Bluetooth.
Pros:
Sound quality is great.
There are 4 different sizes and one of them should fit your ear.
It cancels the outside noise.
I have not tried the waterproof feature yet but it is great to have it.

Cons:
It takes around 10-15 seconds to pair with your phone after turning them on.
The microphone is not that good but I think it is expected given physical constraints of them.
You cannot control the volume or skip songs. (I think they should consider adding a feature to the double-tap, like skipping a song.)

Conclusion: It could have been better but given the price, I am happily using them.

title: Waterproof bluetooth headphones.
body:
TL;DR: noise-canceling works, definitely waterproof (but don't wear them under water because bluetooth), price is a good deal (better than Air Pods), be aware that they are so small people might not realize you're wearing them and will try to talk to you, and don't wear them when you need to be audibly aware of your surroundings (walking in public, riding public transportation, driving).

I bought these because of the price. I searched for the best-rated bluetooth headphones on Amazon.com and found these. I could not bring myself to pay $150 for Air Pods. I just can't. These are typical noise-canceling headphones, which I actually don't like, but they work very well. They come with different sizes of rubber earpieces, so you can find one that fits you best. I took the smallest ones and still couldn't hear anything with them in - anything besides the headphones. I was a little confused by the instructional pamphlet about how to connect the headphones, and that the Right one will connect to your device and then the Left one connects to the right one... blah blah. This is not actually how it played out in real life when I took them out of the box. No matter, as they were set up in a few minutes. I paired my phone with the Right one and then the Left one caught up. It will still show up in your list of devices, but it won't connect. Don't worry, like I did, that this means something is wrong. You can't connect to the Left one.

I wore them in the shower. The pamphlet says this is okay, and I can confirm, they work in the shower. They are very small and unobtrusive. They work very well on phone calls. One issue could be that since no one can see the devices in your ears (if you have long hair that covers your ears), you may have people come up to talk to you while you have them in and they don't know that you have them in. You won't be able to hear them talking to you because of the noise-canceling feature.

I don't recommend wearing these while walking alone at night, while walking across busy streets, while riding public transportation, while driving a car or in any situation where you need to be aware of what's going on around you, as you will not hear it. The rubber earpieces fit so well in the ear canal as to block out any outside noise. They do also have the noise-canceling feature. I'm not an audiophile so I can't analyze the quality of music playing. If I can hear it, that's good enough for me.

title: Earbuds ok, customer service excellent
body:
This product was for my husband since he travels for work and needed hands free calling. We wanted an alternative to the very expensive Apple air buds. Although the design and concept are nice, they didn’t fit as comfortably as expected and seemed to fall out easily. They do come with different size ear “plugs”, so that could be user error. The sound quality was decent and battery life also ok, not superb.
Although the product itself isn’t great, for the price I think it’s fair compared to the market and we have friends that recommended these.
Customer service has been by far the best reason to purchase, they worked with us on getting a new charging box after my husband misplaced less than 6 months after purchase.
I recommend this vendor because it is hard to find good service these days.

title: Really Happy
body: I was a little skeptical that these were really noise cancellation headphones, but I was on a flight and tried them out and I was happy that it did cancel a LOT of the noise on the airplane.  I did have to insert them tightly and twist them towards the back of my ear to get a good seal.  Super happy with this purchase as they don't take up too much room.  The only downside is that the charged battery only lasts about 4 hours and I had to recharge them.  It does not take very long to recharge though.

title: Don’t stay in ear well
body: Connectivity and ability to use either earpiece solo is appealing. They noise cancel. They do not stay in the eat well at all unless you really cram them in your ear, which usually causes pain after an hour of use. The sound level is quite loud.

title: Overpriced earbuds with bad sound quality
body: Definitely not worth the $50 that they are listed as, the sound quality is really sub-par, you can hear a little bit of static in the background and that can become quite the annoyance after some time. If you’re looking for good quality sound, better go somewhere else or spend the extra money on a more reliable, well-known brand.

title: Didn't stay in my ears. Nothing ever does though.
body:
Beautiful, cool looking, edgy.  Perfect except for they wouldn't stay in my ear.
Tbh that's probably more to do with me than the company.  Most ear buds won't stay in my ear. Actually all of them. I have weird ears I guess lol.
Had no business getting this type of ear bud knowing that.
I saw one person say that he'd always had a hard time keeping ear buds in his ear as well and these worked for him, so I thought it would work for me as well. Not so.  I looked cool trying though. The case even lights up. Sucks that I have odd ears that couldn't make it work. I would have loved to rock these.
Even though they wouldn't stay in my ear I'm still going to give 3 stars, I can tell it's a high quality product and definitely eye catching.

title: High quality, low price
body: Apple airpods wearer for a couple years. went thru the trouble of trying to clean them several times, losing patience with them. Found these highly rated by thousands for $50. Shocked by the easy pairing and sound quality. Love them. Hope they last a while, and if they don't the price isn't too bad. The left one tends to fall out of my ear, i may need to stick in differently. Not sure how long the battery life is or how long it takes to charge, but these were pretty much ready to go as soon as I unboxed them.

title: The very best wireless earbuds I have ever owned
body: If you are looking for high quality wireless earbuds then I recommend getting these. I had tried other wireless earbuds in the past, but they had flaws, such as disconnecting, flickering, etc. I finally decided to give these a try, and they are phenomenal. You can tell they are solidly built with good materials. They sound great, have really good bass, they sync very easily, never drop the connection, and are great for wearing while exercising since they are waterproof. It is also quite convenient how they can be charged using a wireless charger. I was so satisfied with these that I bought two more pairs, one for my wife and one for my father. They have both had equally positive experiences with these.

title: Best True Wireless Headphones on Amazon!
body: I can’t use AirPods due to the fit and I have had too many bad experiences with not true wireless headphones. I bought these not thinking much but the quality has been incredible. The sound is beautiful. Same quality at beats or Bose. Easy. Their customer service is very helpful and prompt with their responses and they care about you, they really do. These are top of the line quality, the boxing is perfect and they are wonderful to use. I have them with me all day listening to books and on the phone. I have already bought another pair I love them so much!

title: Very nice
body: I never right a review, but these are great nice and small and I left them outside in a thunderstorm and thought they were done for but I put them in and they work just fine. I am very very happy with them. The sound is great. The only down fall is it’s hard to see the right and left on the buds. Good product for the money

title: Great product for the price
body: Bought primarily for Peloton and running.  Surprised with sound quality, particularly bass when playing music.  Find myself using these for calls as well and nobody has complained about the voice quality, so I think the microphone is decent.  The charging case is pretty cool.  Not small enough to fit in your pocket (without looking / feeling bulky), but I generally keep it in my backpack.  For the price, I am very happy with purchase and quickly ordered a 2nd pair for backup.

title: Lightening deal gone right!
body: Iphone user. Wanted to buy AirPods, but did not want to pay their outrageous price. Saw this deal on amazon and decided to try it out. Sounds quality is great when listening to music! However when you make phone calls, the other person says it picks up a lot of background noise. To me it sounds great, but bothers the other party. Battery life is good (don't know how many hours). I haven't tried it while exercising, but I am sure while listening to music it is great. Overall, if you don't want to spend a ton of money on AirPods and want something for everyday without braking your wallet-this IS the thing for you!

title: Great product for an amazing price
body: There’s not a whole lot I don’t like from these headphones. I’m very surprised by how easy the pairing process was even to use as separate headphones. I love the battery life on these, I use them for work and they last me my shift. I love how discreet they are and light weight they are too. They are super simple function, so if you’re looking to go 100% hands free these may not be for you. You can’t skip music, control volume but these are truly perfect for me.

title: Great Customer Service!
body: These earbuds were amazing workout earbuds! I have ruined several pairs of earbuds by sweating while working out, but these are truly water proof. When an issue arose with the charging of the right earbud, the customer service representative was extremely quick and helpful in responding. Overall I was very impressed with the product and company service!

title: Not good for running.
body:
I bought these earbuds solely for the purpose of long distance running. They just don’t stay in your ears or “lock in” somehow, even with every bud attachment I tried.
They’re a bit too heavy to stay in. It’s fine if you’re sitting at a desk, but if you start moving around they start to fall out & eventually do.
The sound quality is grand and they seem well made but I would NOT advertise these for athletic performance whatsoever. I kinda feel like I’ve been had.

title: Very, very happy customer!!
body:
I've had my TOZO earbuds for about 3 weeks now and I love them. When I got them, I had to change the earbud shells (which are included) because my ear canals are small, but once I did I have never had any trouble with them falling out or feeling uncomfortable. The first time I put them in and connected them to my phone and started music, I was AMAZED at the quality of the sound, particularly the bases. I've never had any other earbuds or headphones that match the quality of sound, the comfort, the battery life, or the ease of use as the TOZO earbuds.

I was somewhat cautious when I was considering buying them because of some reviews that state that when they use them at the gym, the connection fails repeatedly. I only use mine at the gym and I've never had this happen. The signal strength seems to remain consistent and, once connected to any device, I've never experienced any drop in the signal.

In short, I'm incredibly happy with these earbuds and my purchase. They are probably the best things I've bought from Amazon in years.

title: Sound quality poor and not great battery life
body: I was really looking for something that had good battery life, excellent sound quality for listening and speaking, and would not fall out of ears, or hurt after little wear. Unfortunately this product didn't deliver on any of these. Sound quality okay/meh for listening, but people had great difficulty hearing me. These often fell out and hurt my ears only after an hour.

title: Not one size fits all
body: Very hard to keep in your ears. Dont stay connected to blue tooth well while working out. Didnt come with diff inserts for ears def not one size fits all. Other then that they seem decent. Company offered new set if I wrote a new review. When I did not, they never sent a new pair.

title: Good Quality!
body: This is the second pair of blue tooth earbuds I have purchased.  These by far are much better sound quality than the other brand I owned.  So far the charging time works well for my workouts and they stay in my ears without a problem whether it be strength training or running.  The customer service is great I needed a replacement for a torn earbud and they sent out a new set right away.

title: They worked for 1 week, now only one headphone holds the connection.
body: When I first received the headphones on August 30th, 2019 -- I loved them!! About a week & a half later, the left headphone started losing the connection while in use. Sometimes it skips in & out for an entire song! I'm beyond disappointed. I wanted to both believe in & support this company & their product. The headphones are going back this week.

title: Good headphones
body:
I bought these a couple of weeks back, the sound is sharp, the battery life is perfect for a workout session.
They fit nicely on my ears (although that could vary). Pairing is easy and fast.
The problems arose a couple of days after starting using them, The right pod stopped working.
I tried every video and how to Tozo has and unfortunately they just stopped working.
Reached out to their support and waiting on them, but for now, I will just add an overall 1 star since they did not last long, might change it if it was just a bad batch that I received.

title: Great bluetooth earbuds for every day use
body: I bought these earbuds because I like to listen to podcasts in bed and with headphones it hurts laying on my pillow with an earbud being pressed against my ear.  With these you can either pair both earbuds or just one and it works great! Sound quality is good and the case works great because you can charge it and then put your earbuds in the case and it will charge the earbuds. I really recommend these earbuds for the great price.

title: Updated:  Received replacement earbud.  Good customer service
body:
Updated:  Received replacement earbud.  Good customer service
_______________________________________________________________________________________________________

The sound on this earbud is pretty good.  Good highs and lows.  However, my left earbud (slave) kept cutting out.

Also there's no option to adjust the volume directly on the earbuds.  Both left and right earbud button do the same things.

title: The ear buds that changed my mind about wireless!
body: This product is awesome! I was hesitant to get on the wireless earbud train, but these have completely changed my mind. They connect automatically when I take them out of the charging case, which conveniently comes with a cord to make sure they aren't easily lost. The water resistant aspect is also super awesome! I have sweat while using these and it hasn't impacted the sound quality and I dont have to worry about damaging the headphones. The charge has lasted me a couple days of heavy listening to podcasts and music. Would recommend to anyone, especially for the great price!

title: Worth the Money So Far!
body: I love to sleep while I listen to music but always fear that even “wireless” headphones will get wrapped around my neck. These provided a great solution and the charging case means that even when I’m not sleeping I can use them almost anywhere, anytime, even discreetly at work. You also have the option of using only 1 earbud at a time. I haven’t had them long so I can’t say much about the battery life but so far so good.

title: Not reliable long term
body: I used this for only 4 months before it started not holding a charge and was no longer reliable on a regular basis. Today was the final straw. I should be able to make phone calls and use it on my runs (longest run was 12 miles) but it keeps not working. I came onto Amazon to get them returned but apparently the window to returns is closed. I definitely DO NOT recommend if you are going to be using them for longer than 4-6 months. Now I have to find a new pair and $40 doesn’t seem like a lot of money but to this mom of 7 every dollar counts.

title: great product. would buy again
body:
these are great. batteries last a while and especially since I store em in the case/battery I go about a month before having to recharge the case and i use em 3-4 days a week at the gym.

my ONLY issue with em after a few months of use is since I use em at the gym I'll occasionally bump one out of my ear and they're not always super easy to find against a dark gym floor, plus they tend to bounce and roll heh. but that's a rare occurrence

title: Excellent sound quality but short battery life
body:
I have listened to many headphone of different types and brands.  These are the best sounding out of all of them, when they are deep enough in my ears.  They sound very bass heavy (like its electronically boosted) but doesn't distort the sound.  The treble sounds prominent enough and not harsh.  They have good detail and sound stage.
  The main problem with these for me is they start to slowly come out of my ears after a few minutes of putting them in my ears (especially the left side) they then lose bass, audio quality and outside sound dampening.  I know many people don't have this problem so I won't subtract stars for that.  If anyone else has that problem I've found that wearing a head band helps a lot to keep them in.
  The battery life of both the batteries in the buds and the charger is low.  I have about 2 hours of listening time and the charger can charge the buds about 2 times before it needs to be charged again.
  The buds are not very comfortable, so I can only wear them about an hour and cannot sleep with them in.  I thought the button on the buds was going to be a soft touch button but you have to actually push it pretty hard in to get it to work.  The button can only pause/play the music, not skip songs or change the volume.  Speaking of volume, these have it in spares (when they are deep enough).  These buds are also very good at blocking most outside sound (again, when they are deep enough).  I love how they are waterproof so I can wear them in the bath.
In summery,  these would be 5/5 buds only based on there sound quality.  I wish all my headphone sounded this great.  The battery life and comfort subtract 1 star.
**Updated Review 5/15/19**
I had a problem with my right earbud and TOZO sent a whole new set, no charge!  Excellent customer service!!
So I gave them one more star.

title: Great for Audiobook Listeners
body:
I love being able to pop in an earbud and cacthing up on my audiobook everywhere I go! While shopping, waiting in line, going for walks and even in the shower!
I have reviewed several wireless earbuds and these are the ones I settled on. I like the premium features like the wireless charging and waterproofing. It's nice being able to pop one ear bud in before a shower. I also frequently only use one earbud so I like that Right earbud can easily fit in either ear. I would recommend these headphones.

title: Do not hesitate to buy.
body:
These just arrived. I have messed with a few wireless earbuds in the past but these are by far the best in every category. They're lightweight. Boast excellent sound through the ranges, and even bump  with the right music.

I commute an hour each way to and from work. Tired of messing with a chord, tired of messing with bulky headphones. These are perfect.

title: Good headphones if they fit your ears (see update)
body:
The company reached out to me and offered to send a smaller model of their headphones, which I appreciated. However, they kept pestering me for an update on my review almost daily, even though I hardly had a chance to try them out. The headphones are good quality, but the seller will not leave well enough alone, and the whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth.

These headphones sound good and work as expected. However, they are large for just earbuds. They fit larger ears quite comfortably, but smaller ears they do not fit properly, they do not sit properly in the ear, thus making them loose. Another drawback of this product is that headphones themselves don't have buttons themselves to pause/play whatever media you are listening to.

In short I would recommend these headphones if you do not have small ears, and do not need the ability to control your phone's audio from the headphones.

title: Comfortable and sounds fantastic!
body: I really like these earphones! They are comfortable yet stay in your ear. I didn’t want to spend the $$$ for the Apple EarPods which won’t stay in my ear in active situations. The TOZO product comes with several sizes of caps so they fit well. Yesterday I was traveling at interstate speed and talking to a family member who also has an iPhone. With my TOZO earphones in, the vehicle noise disappeared and the sound was fantastic!  It sounded like the person was talking next to me. I also like how easy it is to charge and operate these earphones.

title: Great
body: Very happy with the quality of these. Charge time, sound quality, fit and function. Great bass response and the high's are not shrill. I can clearly hear cymbals etc. I use high quality downloads from Spotify and also low loss MP3 format and the audio quality is very impressive. Its all great.

title: Not great....
body: The sound quality isn't great, but the earbuds are pretty cheap so I expected that. However they also have a terrible Bluetooth connection. You can be holding your phone in you hand linked to your earbuds, and even a couple feet from the ear buds they cut out constantly as if you are 30 feet away. They're cheap and you get what you pay for, but with these any amount is a waste of money.

title: Charging case doesn’t last long.
body: I really liked this product, but the charging box doesn’t stay charged. I have to keep it plugged in to charge the ear pieces, which only stay charged on their own for 2-2 1/2 hours.

title: Works and incredible for the price -- but lack of volume/skip is a real bummer
body:
First of all, I feel like it's insane you can get $50 Bluetooth headphones like these. So the value is amazing. They don't always automatically pair (I have to select them on my phone) and Bluetooth audio sometimes skips a handful of times an hour but that's fine, I chalk that up to Bluetooth in general. (And if I put my phone in my front jacket pocket instead of my side pocket, it never skips -- that's radio waves for ya.)

BUT the fact that I can only pause/play music by tapping the button, and can't change volume or skip... UGH. It's really annoying. I'm the type of person who keeps a big playlist of everything, and when a song comes on skips it half the time because it's not my mood... and this is while biking/running... so to really enjoy these I'm forced to create more separate "mood" playlists, which I guess is fine, but I'd rather not.

Instead I'd **much** rather have a double-tap do the next track and triple-tap go to the previous one, like other headphones do. (Right now double-tap makes a phone call, which is useless.) Even better, I'd happily pay an extra $20 if it had a touch-sensitive surface to tap and gliding would change volume. (Clicking the button in my ear puts pressure on my inner ear which is not painful exactly, but also certainly not comfortable.)

Also -- holding the charging case and feeling its weight distribution makes it clear that it's mostly empty space on the inside! So make it *smaller* please... it's too big to keep in your pocket, which is where you want to keep it. A slimmer version would make this even nicer.

The sound quality is meh -- serviceable but nothing special, and the bass is a bit too strong for me -- I actually pick the "bass reducer" EQ on Spotify to compensate a little bit, though it doesn't do much. I mean, I assume these are essentially $10 headphones with another $40 worth' of batteries and microchips and Bluetooth.

Finally the eartips are great -- I have large ears and so I can only buy in-ear headphones that come with large tips included, and these do. Honestly if Apple made AirPods with the in-ear seal like these, I'd buy them in a heartbeat... but they don't. (Don't know why... they used to sell in-ear headphones as an alternative to their normal ones.) But until Apple does, it honestly seems like these ones are your best bet.

title: A good pair of Bluetooth buds without the Bluetooth earbud price
body:
Likes: Nice compact design, nice charging case, good bass, noise cancellation is good, price

Dislikes: Wonky controls, battery life is a bit disappointing.

Just got these things. So far, they’re a pretty solid pair of earbuds. The sound isolation and bass are awesome. Connecting was a synch. Charging case is a nice size and has a magnetic lid. The charging case also charges fast as well. However, there are two things I don’t like about these earbuds. The first problem with these things are the way they fit in your ear. In my opinion, they don’t really look all that great (picture above). This leads to my second problem: the controls. Both earbuds can play, pause, and skip tracks. But I can’t press the button or else the earbud will go into my ear canal. So you would have to take out the earbud out of your ear, press it, then put it back in your ear.

Are these better than AirPods? The answer is no.

Are these better than other budget options? Yes.

Verdict: If you want a pair of good sounding Bluetooth earbuds, without breaking the bank, these are major go.

title: 32beans
body:
Pro - comfortable enough to use for my small ear.
-Sound quality pretty good

Con- even fully charged last only 2 hours.
-No volume control on ear pieces so you have to have your phone close by.

title: Decent earbuds, but not what you should be getting for $50
body:
When I ordered these earbuds, I was ready to get excited. My last pair (a pair of ENACFIRE earbuds) had been great and for $10 more I was hoping to get a pair of earbuds that would be everything my previous earbuds had been with a little bit extra to boot (sound quality, I figured).

Instead, I just got more and more frustrated with the earbuds the more I used them. Here is what I experienced:

- When I put both of my earbuds in the case to charge, it would often only register one of them, and getting the other one to sit right in the case so it could start charging was a huge hassle.
- I’ve concluded that these earbuds are NOT designed with left-handed people in mind, as putting my phone in my left pocket results in a really poor connection between the earbuds and my phone.
- The connection is a little better when your phone is in your right pocket, but interruptions still occur here and there. When biking, especially with your phone in your left pocket, the amount of interruptions you get just from moving your head is unforgivable.
- This might be a mostly personal thing, but I found that none of the earbud tips included fit my ears. The medium ones were too small and the large ones were too large. I actually had to take a pair of tips off of a different set of earbuds in order to make them work.
- Another annoying thing: my previous earbuds (and I think airpods as well?) connect to the previously paired device within a couple seconds of taking them out of the case. These take like a solid 30 seconds to do so; I initially thought you had to re-pair the earbuds every time you wanted to use them.
- As others have mentioned, there is no way to control any aspect of your music with these earbuds, not even pausing, playing, or changing songs.

BIG RED FLAG: something that really bothers me is that after you activate your warranty, you receive an email offering you a free wireless charger IF you submit proof of a good review on amazon. Seems like shady business practice to me and explains the overwhelming number of good reviews.

As I said, these earbuds are alright. If you only care about sound quality, waterproofing, and battery life, these might be worth your money. Otherwise, I recommend finding another brand.

title: Great Sounding Earbuds - Great Price
body: After reading through reviews for a dozen or more earbuds, I decided to give the Tozo Earbuds a try, and I’m glad I did! The packaging they arrived in was really nice. The earbuds paired with my iPhone as soon as I took them out of the charger. The earbuds come with a variety of cushions to ensure that they fit securely in your ears. Once I chose the right size covers, the fit was perfect. I recommend these earbuds to anyone who wants a great product without breaking the bank.

title: Great Bluetooth headset for commuters and active lifestylers
body:
Purchased a couple of Bluetooth earbuds since my iPhone one stopped working, each of of them have their own challenges. TOZO T10 Bluetooth were great from the get-go, easy to setup, works very well. Light weight and the most attractive part to me was how well they fit, the boxes comes with 4 sizes for ear bud tips, use the size that works best for you, they never fell off or gives a feel of coming out while in use/commute/working out.

Definitely recommend!!

title: Waterproof af
body:
not bad, die fast. sometimes one doesnt charge. good collection of fits though and sometimes they work flawlessly.
EDIT: just took mine out of complete washer and dryer cycles on high heat with my clothes and they still work gr8.  i mess with these.

title: Poor Fit
body: I like everything about these except the fit. When I insert and wear them as instructed, they stay put for about a minute and then come loose and... plop ...fall on the floor. The body is too large to fit into the pocket in my ear. And unlike other smaller buds, if they don’t fit snugly the weight of them causes them to fall out. These will be going back.

title: Amazing sound, great customer service
body:
So I ordered these and the left one refused to pair. I followed all the steps repeatedly, reset, etc.  so I contacted Tozo customer service directly from their website. They asked me if I did x z y etc. which I had and nothing worked so they immediately sent my a new pair at no charge.
They’re fantastic seriously. The sound is amazing!  I have tiny ear canals apparently so have to use the smallest size buds (you get four sizes) but once I got the right fit they stay in really well.
If I had anything bad to say if would be the same as all earbuds I’ve used which is that sweat gets into my ear.
So happy with this purchase!

title: So Far, So Good!
body: Love these so far! Been using them for a couple of weeks now and have worked perfectly. They pair easily and sound great. Think I'll order another pair for my son who's been pestering me for his own set. A great buy!

title: Good price and great quality
body: Great price and quality.  Instructions and online videos are helpful during pairing process and fitting.  Worked well during a run and normal gym activities.  Would recommend to friends.

title: Cheap ear buds. Stay away.
body: Amazon sent me a replacement of these wireless ear buds because the last pair was had to much static during playback. The second second set worked good for one workout then the right way but no longer charges or even turns on.  I can't imagine getting another set to find something else on these that don't work.  Cheap quality goes with the cheap price. Stay away.

title: Great product for the price!
body:
These ear buds, although they not a big brand name, are really Good! The sound quality, base, and battery life are all actually pretty good. I haven't been able to try the Samsung ear buds or air pods yet but from all of the ear buds I've had these are probably the best. Not to mention that the price is great!

The only thing I would say that this product was not at it's greatest is that you cannot connect each ear bud individually to whatever device you're using. However, that is not a big deal.

title: Better sound than my Samsung Galaxy Buds
body:
I bought these as a cheaper alternative to my expensive Samsung Galaxy buds when doing dirty outdoor yard work.  I quickly found that the sound quality was better than my Samsung buds when doing things with a lot of background noise, such as mowing the lawn.  The bass and midrange comes through with a lot more clarity in noisy environments.

Customer service was very responsive when I needed to contact them.

title: Quality Audio, Reasonable Price, Comfortable
body:
I purchased these headphones after the death of my previous sets of wired headphones in a series of cat-related cord-chewing disasters: quite frankly, I had been avoiding bluetooth headphones due to the cost and because I expected the sound quality of reasonably priced wireless headphones to be poor.

Given the reviews on this product, I bit the bullet and made the $50 purchase, and I'm honestly very glad I did. The headphones themselves were relatively comfortable straight out of the box, but were better once I changed the earpieces. They stay in well; I haven't had them fall out while running, mowing, or working, and they are IPX8 so I also haven't had any issues with sweat or moisture. The noise cancellation of the headphones is also wonderful, as it's hard to hear anything with them in. This could be alternately a blessing or a curse depending on what you're doing, but they worked so well that I can't deduct anything from them for being well designed.

In terms of battery life, the earbuds themselves last for around 10 hours of constant music on a full charge. Not bad! Certainly better than I had anticipated.

All in all, these headphones are exactly what I wanted from a pair of reasonably-priced bluetooth earbuds, and I would absolutely recommend them to others!

title: Ehh these are not a 5 star product maybe 3 at best
body: Bulky, uncomfortable.  If you use them for running they fall apart fast, the plastic rubber wears out from sweat.  Sound isn't good ether.  Most phone calls I make on them no one can hear me properly.  Rather cheap product.  Would not recommend or purchase again.  Battery goes in 2 months after heavy use.  I don't even use them anymore.

title: Some pros, some cons
body: I was really excited for these but ultimately they're not satisfactory for me. They are too big for my ears and therefore don't fit right (regardless of which size ear attachment is used). They fall out when running. Other cons: They are difficult to turn on/turn off/connect to device. I'm always confused every time I take them in and out of the charging case what is going on. Flashing lights, doesn't auto connect to device, etc. It's too complicated and I end up spending too much time on them. Sound quality is very good, but ultimately these aren't for me.

title: Impressive earbuds
body: So far so good. I’m very impressed with these earbuds, and It was a breeze to setup the pairing. Here’s a tip for getting the right fit - start with the smallest earbud sleeve, then go to next larger etc until one fits firmly and blocks out more ambient sound, so the bass sounds deeper. At this point the sleeve will also help with a snug fit. I pair it with my galaxy watch when I go jogging. And what’s cool is if you’re going walking or jogging with a friend you can share buds. Very good earbuds.

title: Great Sounding Earbuds
body: These earbuds have a nice audio range - not a ton of bass, but enough to fill out the bottom end, while maintaining good clarity through the mid and high frequencies.  Pairing can be a bit finicky at times, but it's probably more due to my inexperience with wireless earbuds than with this product.  I have not had these earbuds long enough to test their battery endurance yet.  Happy with my purchase so far!

title: Love these Bluetooth ear pieces... ❤️❤️❤️👍👍👍👍
body: Really love these Bluetooth ear pieces. Baught 2 pairs these year cause my husband stile my 1st one. Love that they are water proof especially chasing after a toddler. So happy will more then likely get my son a pair too

title: Poor Sound and Bad Fit
body:
I really wanted to like these wireless earbud, if for no other reason, they were my first and they were waterproof.  After all, what would be cooler than being able to take a shower with earbuds on.

However, I immediately noticed that they did not fit in my ears at all.  At first, I thought it was because the ear caps were too small but even after putting in larger ear caps and twisting the ear buds into ear canal, they still felt very unstable.  Even though they are not that large, the lack contour and the weight distribution just feels all wrong.

The part that bothered me the most was the tinny sound that they produced.  This disappointed me more than anything since so many reviews here said that the sound was amazing.  I am not an audiophile by any means but you will immediately notice that the bass is missing.  Another weird thing is that I could never get the volume right.  As a song would play, it would become very soft and then way too loud where it became uncomfortable.

Overall, I just can not recommend these to anyone.  I really wanted to but just can't.

title: Great product at a great price!
body:
This is a great product for the price. Great sound quality and battery. I recommend this product for anyone looking for a good set of wireless ear buds at a great price.
The only thing I am having trouble with is that after I pair them they don't automatically connect when I pull them out of the case. To me this isn't a big deal for the price point. I'm just more curious if it's me or that is just how they work. So my question is do they automatically connect after being paired?
Overall a great product and a fantastic price.

title: Quite surprised on how well this product performs.
body: The packaging was very well done. The pairing is fast and easy. I have it for about a day and it never fell off during my movements, i mainy got this for exercise. The bass is like asmr to my ears. The quality of sound is clear and crisp. Charging is also very fast, and battery last over 3hrs something before you get notified that the battery is low. It magneticly snaps into the charging case so it's hassle free. I am totally happy with this product. It comes with a 1 year extended warranty too.

title: Do not buy!
body: I originally posted a review for these ear buds I thought they sounded great and fit fine. Today walking to work the right one fell out of my ear. And I was unable to find it. As unhappy as I was I tried to just use the left side and it wouldn't work. So $55 out the window. Also the company bribed me to write a positive review so I could receive a power bank I could charge my headphones wirelessly. I did receive the power bank but it was split down its side and it gave off a unpleasant odor. Just thought I should also note that.

title: Beats ear hangers
body: I wanted solid bass with the treble and these deliver. Good battery life, quality case with inductive charging for convenience. Prog metal sounds as good as through wire. Awesome!

title: Excellent headphones and a bargain for the price!
body: I have been looking for quite a while for bluetooth headphone solutions that give both good sound and actually securely stay in my ears for riding, running, and other physical activities.  These Tozo earbuds are hands down the best product I have found for it.  Also, the carrying case is super handy - safely and weathertight storage on the go that you can recharge with any mini-usb.  The earbuds are very easy to use and set up.  Strongly recommend!

title: TOZO T10 TWS Bluetooth 5.0 Earbuds
body:
I must say, "I love these buds!"  The sound is great, battery life really suits my lifestyle, I am working on a degree program, and it requires a great deal of reading and writing, my Zos' are great for listening to music while I work.  The quality is excellent, the carry case is easy to charge on the go, and it charges quickly!  I can't say anything but good things about this product.  I don't post a review often, but this is a great product, for the cost.  You can't go wrong.

Maxine Pepper

title: Great sounding headphones
body: These are very nice headphones. One tends to fall out of my ear, but I think my ear canal must be shaped weird or something. The sound is very good.

title: Excellent Ear Buds
body: These buds are the best I have ever owned. They are easy to set up and pair with your iPhone or Fitbit. Optional bud covers offer a perfect fit in the ear canal and the clarity is outstanding.

title: Wonderful sound and they feel well built
body: The sound on these ear buds are wonderful with plenty of base. The default ear pieces are too large so I changed them out with the next size down and they fit perfectly.

title: Best earbuds for the price!
body: These earbuds work great, good sound, long battery life, easy to use. Some reviews stated the buds would stay in the ear, the ones I have stay in my ears just fine.

title: Don't waste your money read my review
body: Connectivity issues all the time sound quality was extremely cheap the volume wasn't very loud there was like time when you're watching a YouTube video battery life was not good the color white is not good because it gets dirty easily and does not wash off almost like it absorbs the dirt or oil or whatever permanently after putting them in your ear you have to move them just perfect otherwise the sound cuz we're because it blocks your ear canal. I just bought a pair of Jabra Elite active 65t pair of earbuds they're $189 but every penny is well worth it you will hear things you never thought you would the point is you get what you pay for and these earbuds I am giving a rating on as for consumers who don't either have high standards or don't know what they're missing or can't afford anything better either go big or go home the best or nothing especially when it comes to you such a small microscopic piece of technology that you are putting in your ear sometimes you really just can't skimp out on just some words of advice

title: Decent and affordable earbuds, but not waterproof.
body:
The title is misleading: these are NOT waterproof, and it even tells you (amusingly enough, under the heading WATERPROOF) that they are not meant to be submerged in any capacity. This is relatively moot, as Bluetooth doesn't work very well through water anyway.

That aside, the sound quality isn't as good as Airpods, but the battery life is pretty comparable and they look pretty sleek. When you consider these are a third of the cost of Airpods, it makes them a pretty good alternative at an economic price.

title: Awesome sounds quality for a low price
body: Bought these for a trip to Italy. The sound quality is excellent and they really did cancel out a lot of noise on the plane. I bought these after reading the reviews and I was not disappointed. Battery life is very good and I like that the case can charge them several times. Great product for a great price.

title: Cutting Out
body:
Like many reviews mine cut out almost constantly. The left ear constantly drops, while the right ear drops the connection with my phone causing the music to pause. This is with my phone in my pocket. I've contacted TOZO support to see what they can do.  If support has nothing I'll return them. I hate to cause AMAZON any trouble.

Update. I contacted TOZO. They offered a replacement if I "Could you please kindly post your kind experience about the product on the web page first？And then let me know the headline or screenshot  once post it."

I decided to return the item and find a different brand. I'd be really careful!

title: Worth the buy
body:
I’ve been searching for headphones that can resist sweat during workouts, stay place, and produce great sound. These headphones achieved all the above. My only issue is that the earbuds do not fit as instructed. I chose the smallest size bud which fits into my ear canal perfectly however the actual product itself does not line up in my ear exactly how the photo shows.

Overall -  great product! My husband plans to buy himself a pair.

title: Great product!
body: Comfortable to wear.  Get ours of use from a single charge.  Storage container recharges a couple of times between its recharge.  Very happy with the purchase.

title: Amazing earbuds!!
body: I love these earbuds. The sound quality is great and phone calls are clear. I use them for personal use and at work. Battery life is great as well. With me using the navigation and music constantly, I can get about 8 hours per fully charged bud. I got a second pair for my coworker because of how great it is for work as well. And it fits my ear perfectly with the smallest plug. I sweat and move alot at work and it has never fallen out. Very happy with these and the wireless charging feature is a plus.

title: Great product, with great customer service!
body:
I purchased these headphones 8 months ago and have used them almost every day since for exercise and/or at work. A few days ago the right ear bud stopped working for whatever reason and I was SO upset. However today I emailed customer service and they agreed to send me a brand new set of headphones at no charge!!

Moral of the story.. if you are looking for a good pair of Bluetooth headphones, choose these! Not only for the quality of the headphones but the company selling them :)

title: 3.5 Stars if I Could.
body:
This does the trick. Calls sound good. Can listen to music- the bass isn’t that great, but it does the trick.

Only problem is these fall out of the ear too much. The buds that don’t fall out are too big to be comfortable. Pick or choose the flaw.

But overall good quality. Battery could last longer though. 3.5 stars if I could.

title: Very good sound quality. A little issue on connection
body: I have bought many $50-ish wireless earbuds, but this one has the best sound quality.  Everything works very well. They loose one star because of connection issue. Time to time audio stops for about 0.5 second when my phone is in my pocket or in my backpack. It never lose the connection, but a short pause time to time happens. But if my phone is in line of sight from ear buds, it works great.

title: Very Good Purchase
body: Quick delivery, with earbuds charged and ready to go. Pairing went flawlessly, and sound quality is very good indeed. The case/charger is very handy, aided by the accompanying loop to wear it around one's neck. I've had the 'buds for only a few days so can't comment on battery life yer, but it seems quite promising. This is my first pair or Bluetooth earbuds, and I am very pleased with their quality and the overall purchase. Certainly recommended.

title: Smart Purchase
body:
I just received these in the mail yesterday and tested them out. Out of the box, it is incredibly easy to set up. I really wasn’t expecting much out of these but I can assure you that they are on par with Apple AirPods and Samsung’s wireless ear buds as my husband has both.

The sound quality is amazing and for a FRACTION of the price. This is definitely a smart purchase.

title: Just Shy of Great Earbuds
body: I bought these after buying my husband a pair when they were on sale.  He liked his so much that I bought mine full price.  I was disappointed that mine are staticky, like the speaker ruptured or something.  I'm trying to test them to make certain it's the product rather than the quality of the recording I'm listening to.  But they are otherwise good earbuds - I love the charging case, they're comfortable, and they do the job.

title: Left Ear bud quit charging after 2 months
body:
They worked great until they didn't. 2 months and the product quit charging, no returns thru amazon, you have to jump through hoops to submit a claim to the company and wait to hear back if they will exchange or not.
Update: company sent me a new pair 2 days later, and they work great. no issues.

title: Last earbuds you'll need to buy
body: These are absolutely amazing! Sound quality is great, the 4 different size options available ensure a perfect fit in your ear, & they are so super comfortable, I honestly forget if I have them in. I love the chargeable case. I simply charge the case through the night while I sleep, although it doesn't take long at all to get a full charge on the case, maybe an hour or two. Honestly don't know for sure, cause I've never had them die on me. I simply take the case off the charger in the morning, then wear one at a time throughout the day. When one earbud dies, I swap it out for the other, then well before that one gets the chance to run down its charge, the other one is charged & ready to go. You can honestly do that throughout the entire day, & still have charge left in the case before ever needing to charge the case. They are the best!! I've purchased so many that were great (some just ok) at first, but then quickly just quit working all together without any explanation why. I've had these a month already & have no complaints. Will update if anything changes. Pairing up with your phone or device is very easy also. It's labeled either R (right or both) or L (left only), & is so easy to pair or unpair, while swapping back & forth between the two throughout a day's use. I haven't found that the sound is any different when only using one earbud, like can be the case with other earbuds/headphones. I don't miss any sound/dialogue/background noise/music when only one earbud is in use, it's the same as if I were using both. There isn't a way to adjust the volume on the earbuds themselves, you have to use your phone/device. However, unlike previous earbuds I've purchased that started out with the volume level way too soft/quiet needing adjustment, these are perfect with a wide range in volume level. I suggest these to everyone who asks about them. Plus the company, tozo, is great with an extended warranty available & other amazing product offers. Like I said, hopefully the last pair I need to buy

title: Very good quality and sound.
body:
I’ve used them once on a windy, 25 mile woods/road bike ride. The sound was excellent and noise cancellation is very good. Touch features are great as I have this connected to my IPod not my phone so I don’t have a need to take phone calls. The only issue I’ve been having is the connection. Almost the entire ride the buds kept cutting out. Now my iPod was a foot and half behind me in my bag so distance wise that was not the issue. I messed around with them in several stops but it kept doing once I turned them on again. This is frustrating because you want consistent music with no cut outs or interruptions. Not sure if I just have a dud or this is what to expect with something a little cheaper then the big names.

Update: 05/8/19
