The company stepped up very nicely. I continued to have the cutting out issues with music no matter what I did to try and trouble shoot the problem. Contacted TOZO and they gladly helped me by offering some more troubleshooting help but then ultimately agreeing to send me a new pair to fix the issue. Top shelf, awesome customer service. I already enjoyed the product but I think this will put it over the top! Great product for half the cost of the super big names and the customer service is awesome.

title: Pretty good. Fairly comfortable.
body:
I have a bunch of these cheaper little earbuds. I think I have 6 pairs of different ones. They're all damn similar. These are about the same as the others, but are water resistant. Sound quality is comparable among them.

For comfort, I'd say my E19s are a little more comfortable, but these are still very wearable. One thing, when you're using them singly, the one you're wearing beeps a few times after it connects to my phone, as if it's trying to connect to the other one. Then it stops and all's good.

I use these for audio books and podcasts so I can't speak to the music quality. I also wear them when I sleep to block my tinnitus and they're pretty comfortable to sleep in. I do wear them in the ear that I'm not laying on though.

I'd recommend these (all of them, really) for a fairly cheap earbud. For full disclosure, they're offering me a wireless charger or extra charging case as an incentive for writing this review. So that may have introduced some bias. But overall, I'm satisfied.

title: Almost perfect!
body:
For the price, there is a lot to like here!  The sound is plenty good for everyday listening at the gym or around town, although I suspect "real" audiophiles will want something more accurate.  But for my uses, the sound is great.  Fit in my ears is good, although I do notice slightly louder sound in one ear, and I think I need to try different size buds to get a better fit (the louder sound stays in the same ear even if I switch L & R, so it's not a problem with the T10 - the problem is with my ears!).  I like the compact case and the wireless charging is a nice bonus.  Battery life of the earbuds seems pretty close to the claimed 3.5 hours.

Just a few things that keep me from giving a full 5 stars.  One is that I would have preferred USB-C charging, just to reduce the different types of cables I have to keep track of.  Second is that these take maybe 30 seconds or so to pair with my phone (Pixel 3) when I take them out of the case.  Not a deal breaker for me, but just long enough to be annoying.  Next, I do get a slight audio lag when watching videos, which I have read is not uncommon with most of the true wireless buds like these, where the phone only connects to the R bud, as opposed to both L & R like some of the higher end earbuds.  Lastly is, if I leave the buds (fully charged) in the case and the case isn't plugged in, the *case* battery is drained after about 3 days.  So I can't count on the case being fully charged if I am heading out the door for a work trip or something like that.  Maybe the buds are constantly trickle charging from the case?  The case does charge back up fairly quickly, but it's still an annoyance.

Overall, a solid 4 star rating and I would definitely recommend these.

title: These stay in during high energy work outs
body: Okay so let me tell you how frustrating it has been to try and find some fantastic wireless bluetooth headphones I can actually work out in without trouble. I do a lot of Gfit which is high energy, alot of up and down movements. Anyways, these actually stay in, and do not get in my way at all. The sound is awesome and even talking on the phone my family and friends say I sound nice and clear. I highly recommend these !! I love that I can use 1 at a time too.

title: Limited functionality, okay sound
body: I just purchased these...great value at $50, fit perfectly. Two things: 1) sound is okay bass is good but mid/highs are very tinny. Also, one major deal breaker is you can't skip or go back - have to use the phone. Not great if you're working out, riding a bike, etc.  Finally, it doesn't hold the bluetooth signal all that well when moving...constantly cuts in an out.

title: Great wireless earbuds
body:
Extremely satisfied with my purchase!
Good quality earphones especially for the price
I don’t leave my home without them
I drive truck for a living and I used them all night for music and YouTube when I’m waiting for my next run
Overall great package (sound,batteries and fit)

title: Awesome wireless earbuds!
body: I've had these earbuds almost a week now and I love these! Very easy to store and charge, the case has a built in battery meter that shows you how much battery the case has left. I've been able to get about 3 1/2 charges out of the case before charging again overnight. The earbuds turn on and pair with your phone as soon as you detach them from the case, they are magnetic so attach to the case very well with little chance of anything falling out. Haven't tested waterproofness yet but they seem well built and so far sweatproof. GREAT SOUND QUALITY! Will not go back to wired buds after wearing these! Great product!

title: Fantastic Wireless Earbuds
body: I liked these so much I actually bought a set for both my work and home so I always have a pair close by. They connect easily to your phone and have great sound quality. I play mine for several hours before I have any issues with battery life.

title: Sounds good, but does not stay connected
body:
Either it has a very short range or it is a defective piece, but the Bluetooth connectivity drops even when I am sitting still.
Very annoying. Going to return it! :(

title: I didn't expect an $8 cheaper product to entirely blow away the competition--but TOZO TOZO T10
body:
I originally bought these wireless buds to use with my Samsung Note 9 (I wouldn't pay more than $60) for wireless buds, because I'll lose them, and the sound quality isn't going to get much better, until we're comparing these and $150 midrange closed-ear wired headphones.

Sound Quality:
I compared these against iKanzi T10, also purchased from Amazon. The silicone tips of TOZO's are incredibly good. They have a nice solid feel, and a large diameter (compared to iKanzi T10). All 3 of the "waterproof" silicon sizes are pretty large (all 3 sizes make an easy seal, which is the most crucial factor as far as sound quality is concerned when using in-the-ear buds (they are watertight--and marketed for active use around water.) These buds produce a rather balanced soundscape (they faithfully reproduce low-frequency sounds without "boosting".) The wide diameter drivers are able to produce rumbling lows that you really don't get to hear in this price range. I stress the importance of a good water-tight seal between the sound source and the hearing passages, as that wiill generally be the factor that determines the best fidelity--here's a reason why--sound is transmitted through air in the form of pressure waves. When produced by speakers or a PA system sound pressure waves move through multiple meters of open air. In-the-ear buds, such as these are designed to preserve the signal in a near-vaccuum. The seal allows pressure waves to move from the source to the innear ear undisturbed by things like walls, floors, people, other sound. Since the signal loss in this scenario is so low, much less power needs to be used to generate the clean signal. This allows me to hear what exact sounds are being produced during live performances, as oposed to playing blind "understanding". You'd preferably not want to use these as jreal-time monitors, as the closed design provides for a significant amount of passive noise cancellation.

Ease of setup and use:
Your biggest worry will be deciding which size gives you the best results. Buds like these are very easy to setup and use. Simply take both units out of the charging case--the left and right bud will automatically pair themselves to create a stereo BT connection. My Samsung Note 9 can provide me with the expected (10-13) meters of distance before the connection is lost. When you don't want to listen to sounds anymore, just take the buds out of your ears and place them in their magnetically enhanced charging case. The buds immediately disconnect and power-off when they are returned to the charging case. If you've already paired them to your device, you can resume listening by simply taking both buds out of the charging charing case. They will automatically pair to your last used device if available. Unlike most buds I've seen, these don't have a touch-sensitive tap system. The TOZO T10 instead ops for a click-button system. Downside is you need at least 2 fingers to "pinch" the bud, other than that, removing touch grants me an added feeling of stability, knowing that I won't accidently redial my last called number while.

Case design, large (2700 mAh) battery capacity (in the charging case). This case feels nicer than iKazi X9 charging case. The TOZO T10 case is much easier to open than the iKazi, as TOZO uses a magnetic seal instead of a hard-to-open groove designed for a fingernail. The charging case does have a very crappy lanyard (defective shoe lace ) I'd  recommend not using a lanyard to carry this case, or you will likely be missing something by a few days. The charging case itself is wireless-qc capable, and has one micro-usb input for cable-charging. I am so accustomed to using the earbud case to charge my nicotine vaporizer, I had to remind myself that I bought this item for listening to sounds, not to use off-label as a portable charger.

IPX8? IPX8 is an international code. IPX8 level devices are able to work continuously while submerged in water (up to 3 meters, but Bluetooth only h as a range of inches inside water--therefore these will not be usable under the  surface. IPX8 provides for continuous submerged use. Please note that this means the earbuds won't work if you swim with them (while under water) but they will not break from water. I don't know why anybody needs to have earbuds in the shower, but these will work in water, as long as the water isn't submerging the signal.

You will note the largest size bud is softer and larger than the others. This kind of bud is not designed for heavy movement.

How-to change silicon sizes  without frustration:
Simple trick makes many many lives easier: turn the earbud inside out, allowing you to see the central ring, and how easily it can fit when you can see.

title: Great quality ease of operation.
body: These wonderful earbuds came super fast and to a 75 year old non techie they paired very easy and  worked immediately. Thank you for providing a quality product.

title: Honestly Really Surprised
body: I bought these because I needed a pair of headphones and I thought it would be nice to buy a pair that were wireless, but I didn't want airpods. I went searching and took a chance with these since they were only $50. The first thing that caught my eye was the packaging, it was super nice especially considering it was China. The next thing that really suprised me was the sound quality, it's honestly really good for $50, like Ive never tried airpods but I bet its just as good if not better. Noise Cancellation is also really good, I'm currently at a dining hall at my college and it has basically gotten rid of all sound around me, I can just barely hear the people aroubd me. The only thing that's bothering me is that I'm constantly having to push them back in my ear because I feel like they're falling out, but that might change over time and it came with out size earbuds so I might try those out as well. I would definitely recommend.

title: Good Sound, Good Value
body: So far, they work very well. Sound is ok, volume levels are very good, noise canceling is ok, they don’t really stay in my ears all that well, regardless of the size earpiece used, but that’s probably more a function of my ear canal and not the earpieces.

title: Best Headphone Deal of My Life
body: These headphones are great and are everything I was looking for. They hold a long charge, have INCREDIBLE sound, sync seamlessly with my phone and each other, and the charging station cooperates effortlessly with them. They lock in magnetically and automatically connect to your phone when you take them out. I've owned other "wireless" headphones (that had a wire connecting them), and the sound quality on these is vastly superior. There is a decent base with these, something you rarely find in headphones of this size, let alone wireless. I showed them to my neighbor and he had me order him a pair. You can't beat the price for the headphones alone, the box that holds and charges them seals the deal. Buy them you won't regret it.

title: Great product
body: I have searched for a good multi-use earbud for music during workouts as well as business calls. The TOZO has been great. Sound superior to what i have experienced in similar price range earbuds and the connectivity is spot on.  Comes with options to help you get the most comfortable fit. Several hours use with no discomfort.

title: Not bad
body: Not bad but unfortunately for me the design does not allow these to stay in my ear while walking so I use a head band. Sound quality and construction is very nice, but they just don't lock in for my ears, but I don't blame the manufacturer for this.

title: Amazing bluetooth headphones that don't break the bank!
body:
I bought the white version of this product and i've been using it for about a month now and this is just an all around great  product. The white design is very sleek and I've gotten a few compliments about it. There are a lot of pros (+) to this product and some cons (-), which really dont affect the product quality too much.

(+) Great sound Quality and volume. I play these at maybe 1/3 of the volume i used on my old bluetooth headphones. The quality itself is very crisp, clear, and all over balanced.
(+) Noise "cancelling". Although this product isnt an active noise cancelling headphones, with the right sized buds that fits around your ear, it creates a good barrier for outside noise. with the added music it's then basically noise cancelling.
(+) Design and fit. Mentioned earlier, the design is very sleek and its small enough to fit comfortably in my ear without any real discomfort. It also comes with a bunch of different sized buds which you can use to find the perfect size for you. I wear these at the gym and no matter what I do they dont fall out (unless my hand brushes right against them or something)
(+) Battery Life. Ive never had these headphones die on me and I use them very frequently everyday. I never checked the actual hours of battery life, but i usually charge the case to full completion once a week and its usually enough to recharge the headphones as many times needed for that week.
(+) Connectivity. You pair and connect one earbud (R) and then the other (L) usually connects automatically. Connecting/pairing is usually always fast and without any problems. There's a con to this, see below.
(+) Sturdy. I've dropped these individually, and in the case, multiple times on varying surfaces and everything is still intact and working.
(+) Water resistant. It says it's water proof but ive never actually showered or went for a swim with them. I have dropped them in water, and they are fine. I've also had them on when i was at the gym sweating and they're also fine from that.

(-) slightly bulky. The case is more of an oval and just a tad bit bulky so itll have your pockets looking stuffed. It does come with a lanyard string you can use, but I've used a keychain and clip (similar to how the AirPods cases are) and i just carry it around on my keys without a problem.
(-) gets a little discolored. I got the white case and ive noticed its just SLIGHTLY discolored. But this should be a general understanding if youre getting anything white.
(-) Cant really just listen to one earbud. Although this is possible, if you only connect one side (and keep the other in the case) the one that's connected will beep ever so often as if its waiting for you to connect the other side. If you really want to listen to just one you can connect both, and just put the side you dont want to listen to in your pocket or something (just not back in the case)
(-) The mic range isnt that great. The mic is on the R side (i believe) and when theyre in your ears people on the phone cant really hear you talking (unless you start yelling).  I dont make a lot of calls so this doesnt affect me much. A work around for this is to keep the left side in as a speaker and take the ride side out of your ear and hold it near your mouth while you talk.
(-) Potential to get lost easily. This goes without saying much.
(-) Connectivity. It doesnt auto connect when powered on. This is fine for me because i tend to switch between multiple devices all day. It'll stay paired and linked to your devices, but when you power on you have to open the device's bluetooth setting every time and make sure it connects

Hopefully this lengthy review helps someone. There definitely are some cons to this product but as mentioned before, they can all be worked around and does not affect the overall quality of this product.

title: Awesome earbuds and awesome customer service
body: These earbuds sound great. They have the bass I was looking for (I've tried at least 3 different kinds of earbuds on here), I hear different instruments in the music I didn't know were there, and they fit good. I was going to give less stars because my earbuds started cutting out on me, but I contacted TOZO and they were more than willing to help me out.

title: Best Purchase!!!! Made My Day!
body:
This product is also so popular at Amazon Japan. This item was recommended by the Japanese website when I was looking for the wireless ones. Sound is very clear. I use only one side because I am raising  two little babies.

Only one thing I do not like is when it’s connect to cellphone, it takes time. May be 3 mins the longest though.

BTW....I use this when I am inside of the house, listening to the music, watching YouTube videos.  But it means a lot to me. No wires, easy to move around, still hear my babies’ voices. Excellent purchase!!!!!

title: Wow.  What great sound.  Completely suprised.
body: I have NEVER had earbuds that sound this good.  And let me tell you, I have spent a lot of money on high end products.  I’ve only had then a few days and not sure about how they will hold up.  But, if these can make it 6 mos they are a steal at 40 bucks.  I’m going to buy a couple of more sets and put them away.  These are excellent!  My only complaint is my ears get irritated after a while but that is with any in ear headphone for me.  Most stuff in this price range is crap but I was completely blown away, good job Tozo.

title: You truly get what you pay for!! Decent sound on very LIMITED HEADPHONES!!!
body: So I seen all of the positive reviews got very excited about getting some great sounding true wireless earbuds for an amazing price so I pulled the trigger and ordered them!! But I mist say I’m disappointed!!! The only control capabilities it has is to accept and reject phone calls, and play the music! No volume, no skip, or no restart song! All of which are super important if your trying to use these for gym purposes! Not to mention it’s a physical button!! Causing you to further ram the bud in your ear to execute the few commands it does have! The sound quality is “ok” not bad. Not the best or as hyped as a lot of the reviews indicate but I maybe spoiled because I’m used to my Powerbeats 3’s!!! Thought I was going to be able to save a buck but do yourself a favor and save up the money for the new wireless Powerbeats, or Bose, or several top tier headphones!!!

title: Really satisfied
body: Comparing to the IPods, it'a a more affordable option with 99% the same quality.  Sometimes even better.

title: Tozo T10 lives up to their hype
body: I used the Tozo T10 Bluetooth earbuds today while flying cross country. The sound was good and the battery lasted about halfway from Baltimore to San Diego before I had to recharge them. The fit is good though I may try a smaller bud cover on the right side. Apparently that ear is smaller. (who knew?)  They do arrive with a partial charge so it didn’t take long to fully charge them. The charge case is compact but sturdy.

title: Great product for the money!
body: It was easy to pair this product and the sound is totally amazing! I love the way these earpieces feel snug in my ears,  I have no concern about them falling out as with other headphones.

title: Great for listening to music, NOT for making calls.
body: These are great to listen to music anywhere! They do work well when sweating and showering as you can still keep the beats going. However, they do not work well for talking. The other party can barely hear you and you have to talk above normal volume which makes you stand out when around others. No whispering or they simply can't hear you. Even when talking loud, the other person says you sound far away. For 50 bucks they are great for no wires comfort. I am tired of having a dangling cord and having to worry about the 3.5mm jack getting busted if i sit on the phone wrong. Overall, not bad but just know that calls aren't going to be stellar but do work in a pinch of you can talk loud. Noise cancellation is fair and having 4 inserts makes them fairly easy to find a fit for your ears.

title: I’m satisfied.
body: These are great and convenient for work.(Don’t tel my boss.) for the price, this is a better alternative to apple/Bose/Samsung ear buds. The batter lasts about 4-5 hours. I can walk fairly far away from my phone without them cutting out. The wireless charging feature is cool. My truck has a charging pad so I leave the capsule on there while I drive. The ONE and only con is that sound quality does not quite compare to the expensive brands. But on that note, this ain’t an expensive product, and they still sound very good. I would compare the sound quality to the standard apple/Samsung headphones that come with our phones. Would by again for a gift.

title: Not worth purchasing.
body:
When I first purchased these headphones they worked great. After the first month of daily use the headphones would not hold a charge. The connection with my cell phone would disconnect regularly. The battery life went from lasting all day to only lasting 2-4 hours. The last straw was the right ear bud completely stopped working.
Make things worse when I purchased these headphones, I also purchased the extended warranty thinking that it would cover any issues. That was a waste. After spending over half an hour with then, I was advised that the extended warranty only kicks in after t the manufactures warranty is expired.
What a circus. Amazon lost my business. Poor customer service, poor products.

title: Just what I needed!
body: Had some problems at first connecting it with my desktop, but after asking for help it works best with a phone.  Which is ok with me.  Thank you!

title: Just didn't work for my needs.
body: I bought these to replace my wired headphones I was using for working out because the wires were getting to be frustrating. These seemed like they would be perfect for me, they fit snuggly in my ear (once I found the right size rubber fittings - 4 sizes are included) and the sound quality was great for me but lacking for my audiophile boyfriend. I  was excited for my first workout with them but I didn't even make it 10 minutes in before I had to continually begin to adjust them (take them out and put them back in). I lift heavy so sometimes towards the end of a set I make faces, its at this point that it feels like the earbuds start falling out and have to be readjusted. If you're planning on using these for work, play, or a casual workout these will probably work great for you, they just didn't work for my needs.

title: 50 foot music connection to my Pixel XL Bluetooth
body: I'm hooked on these earbuds. They motivate me to excercise as they are sweat proof and waterproof which is important in our tropical climate. At sports events I listen to the game streaming while sitting in the stands. Charging case is cool as earbuds automatically turn on when removed from charging case. Bluetooth 5.0 is giving me music connection @ 50 feet from my phone.

title: Great quality for a superb price!
body: I have purchased bluetooth headphones before and honestly I have not had much success with them and never have been satisfied.  This was my first experience with earbuds and I was intrigued with Tozo's price as well as its features.  I use the device primarily for the gym and during my commute on my bicycle.  I wanted a product that was functional for my needs and didn't break the bank.  The TOZO product lives up to my expectations and beyond!  The sound quality is amazing and the ease of pairing is top notch.  I feel confident in recommending this product to all.  Thank you TOZO!

title: Purdy good
body: These are great Bluetooth earbuds. The water resistant feature is great... I was even able to talk on the phone in the shower and was told the sound quality was better than the Bluetooth  Set up in my truck. My only issue is that the size of the actual  Electronic component is still a bit large so when I am on a long sweaty run no matter how well the silicone interchangeable buds fit, the weight and the force from repetitive striding eventually causes the buds to slip out of my ears.

title: I love these
body: I love these sooooo much. The sound quality is surprisingly good. The case charges the buds quickly and they hold a charge for a decent length of time. I love that  the case has a loop for a strap. I have a strap on mine along with charms and such. It's a little thing but it adds more functionality.

title: Great for what they are
body:
Good sound quality, plenty of bass. Headphones will sound better of course, and home stereo speakers will sound light years better than headphones. So for what they are and the price, they sound great.

They have pretty good range too. I was in a closed room about 20 ft. away without losing connection.

The only downside I would say is I wish the battery lasted a lot longer, at least 6 hours. They last about 2-2.5 hours at full volume.

title: Perfect ear buds I have ever seen
body: I love this product , I tried with multiple ear phones and not satisfied except this TozoT10. I used this to practice my songs with kareoka and gives perfect music . Product Manual is very easy to understand , set up also a just 2 step process . Different size ear buds helps to fit in different ear sizes and it’s shape is perfect fit to sit in the ear and do not feel that it’s dropping .Overall I love this product as of now , Iam using it every day since I purchased .i purchase this product again if required extra pair

title: Keep losing  signal
body: Dislike keep losing  program  signal play  for  5-7min then loses  signal also try all earbuds which  none stays in

title: High end quality w/o $200+ price
body: Wow I am impressed with this pair. I mainly bought to use when watering my garden around property. Fit great in ears. Sound quality is boss. My previous earphones had wire that would get tangled or pull out of ears. These have no wire so they never fell out while I moved or yanked heavy water hose around gardens. Noise cancellation is great when neighbor is mowing lawn. Worth my money and I'm happy I did not have to buy expensive other brands. Charging case is conveniently small and compact does not take up space even in my small purse. Bluetooth and pairing was easy with cell, car, mp3 player. I can wear it comfortably even with my tragus hoops on.

title: Too small always falling out
body: These do NOT fit everyone. They are huge and don’t fit in my ears at all. They dangle until they inevitably fall out. Forget about being to exercise with these. I’ve just spent half of my lunch chasing them as they fall out every time I chew. They don’t cancel out in noise because they aren’t even in my ear. I try to jam them in but they pop right out. Terrible!

title: Awesome Earbuds.
body: Great sound. Noise cancellation is also very good. Fits perfectly in my ear. My wife had a different brand earbud. She liked this earbud so much, she took this one and gave me hers. I didn't like the other one either. So, I bought another set of these earbuds. The only feature I wish this earbuds had was volume control. Not a big deal since I have my phone close by all the time.

title: My ears might be a lil to small but
body: I love these. I let my brother use them and now he wants some. They lasted me like 6 hours of listening time. And I haven't use them in the shower yet but they are very noise canceling. Very discreet and they charge quick.

title: Bigger but a lot better...
body:
I had the t8 version before the 10. These took the t8 quality and made them much better. The sound, the comfort. They added the magnetic features which is nice and the case seems a lot more sturdy.

The one thing to look out for, the buds are bigger but for em that’s not a big deal, for others it might be. Overall a great product!

title: Are they that good? Yes.
body: These earbuds sound great, with crisp highs and booming lows, and stay in my small ear canals amazingly well. They are also the smoothest-connecting Bluetooth device I’ve ever used. Beyond my expectations in all areas.

title: Can't get any more convenient
body:
Five stars purely for the convenience. Extremely easy to use. Pull them out if the box and they instantly start trying to pair. Wireless charging box has worked on every charger I own. Take them out and they're ready to use; put them away and they start charging. Very simple.

Sound quality is surprising. Still great even if it's noisy around you, though it may not suppress all surrounding noise. I listen mostly to podcasts and talk on the phone. Everyone has said they're impressed with how I sound.

I have one large insert in my left ear and one extra large insert in my right and they fit great for my ears.

Overall, I'm happy with this purchase and am considering giving them as a gift.

title: Left ear bud stopped working
body: After one use the left earbud stopped working and I would like a replacement free of charge sent immediately

title: Fits Like Glove!!
body: I've finally found ear pods that actually fit my ears!!! I've searched high and low for years trying to find ear pods that won't fall out of my ear while I'm walking but now I've found TOZO!! They came in a timely fashion and it came in attractive packaging. As soon as I opened the packing I was surprised at how nice the ear pods looked but what really got me was the sound quality! These little ear pods have very nice bass to them and the quality of sound allows you to hear little nuances in your music, that you ordinarily would not hear. Pairing your ear pods to my phone was effortless. You just have to make sure that you connect the (right earpod) first, which is the dominant ear pod and the left ear pod will automatically connect once the (right earpod) connects. Another nice feature is the charging case. Once you've paired your earpods and taken them out of the case, the earpods will automatically connect to your phone. When talking on the phone, the person could hear me clearly, which is another feature I look for in earpods. I have not had the earpods long enough to comment on how long the battery life is but if its anything like the other positive features of these earpods I'm sure I won't be disappointed. THANK YOU TOZO!! GREAT PRODUCT for a reasonable price!!!

title: Very nice headphones
body: I initially bought one for my dad and got myself a different one from a different company and the quality was so noticeable.  The sound was much clearer and more crisp on the T10's so I returned the ones I had and bought the T10s again. The comfort, the case, the sound quality is all fantastic.  Also the little features such as the waterproof ability and wireless charging case that you didn't think you need but now that you have it it is amazing.

title: Great quality for the price, I use these everywhere I go
body: Right out of the box, this product oozes quality. Everything is packaged very nicely. It comes with many different sizes of earbud covers, so I was able to find one that fit my ears perfectly. I can vigorously shake my head around and the earbuds stay on snugly. The sound quality is very good for earbuds, and it is very good at cancelling sound. In crouded hallways with lots of talking, I could barely hear any talking, and the audio was really clear. The case is very convenient, as whenever you take out the earbuds, they automatically turn on, pair to each other, and pair to your device. I would be listening to my music in less than 10 seconds after taking them out of the case, not even having to look at my phone. The battery life wasn't a problem for me, I haven't had to worry about it yet. For this relatively low price, I 100% recommend these earbuds.

title: Very discreet and excellent to hear music
body: Excellent choice to listen music, or pod-casts.  However, the microphone is a serious drawback.  My voice is reported as very faint and difficult to understand when I use them in phone calls or conferences.  Battery life is great.

title: i cant hear
body: i would like to use them.but u c i am total deaf without hearing aids. i thought they would help but sad to say i cant hear with them  sorry  shelbyi think they are fine, if i could hear . but i have to have hearing aids in.and i caNT HAVE BOTHI WISH I COULD USE THEM SHELBY

title: Music to my ears!!
body: Finally earbuds with the sound quality worth bragging about. This was my fourth set and was losing hope in finding a decent set of earbuds but persistence prevailed. Absolutely the best sounding earbuds at this price point.  I will also point out that once you put these in your ears, which TOZO actually gives you directions for proper listening pleasure, you are totally immersed in music.  I only use these in the gym and I can actually say I can’t hear anybody else around me and can’t hear that crappy music they play over their sound system!!!

title: fantastic customer service.
body:
Update 3:

Customer service was able to show me how to connect a single device. I'm not sure why I couldn't figure that out. I'm still not entirely sure what the beeping means but I can get the right channel into a state where it beeps every 10-15 seconds indefinitely. Not complaints about the product.

Update 2:

After I had some issues I emailed TOZO. They responded immediately and offered to send me a second pair, no questions asked. They told me not to bother to return them. They also said the problem was rare. The next morning I got an email asking if I would like a free wireless charger. Definitely good people.

You can put them in your ear and they make noise but that's about it. You can't skip or pause tracks from either unit and if you want to use the right one only it will beep at you to remind you the left one is not connected. I would find another option.

Update 1: after less than 60 days they have quit working.

title: Audio quality is poor
body: Significant audio quality issues when paired with my S9. Sounds like the audio is heavily compressed. I've messed with the sound options as well as developer options with no luck.

title: Great sound, fits well, super easy to use!
body: I only gave the sound quality 3 stars because I'm having a problem with the ear buds cutting out while I'm listening to my books. I haven't been able to pinpoint if it's something that I'm doing, environmental or the bud communication itself. It doesn't happen all the time and more often the left than the right. When I narrow this down, I will redo this review.

title: Low-end/Bass heavy earbuds with quality build and overall sound
body: The TOZO T10 earbuds deliver strong low-end and high volume capabilities. The mids and highs also sound good, but can sometimes be slightly overpowered by the heavy bass in particularly bass-heavy songs; however the headphones' loudness helps compensates for this. The build quality/case seems sturdy and can also support wireless charging. Compared to Pasaonomi PX7 earbuds, these are louder (by ~130%), provide much stronger/heavy-hitting bass, have a better/wireless chargeable case, and also fit better on those that don't have small ears.

title: My new favorite earbuds
body: I purchased these because, yet again, I left my wired earbuds w/ wireless dongle at home. I have a one mile walk from the parking lot for a part of my job that I get to do once a month and so I finally had enough of leaving my earbuds at home.  I immediately hopped on Amazon and was planning on ordering a cheap set of wired Bluetooth earbuds to keep in my vehicle but saw these instead.  I decided on these because as a pool owner, I figured if I accidentally dropped them in the pool,w/ the ipx8 rating, they should be fine.  I received them in 2 days w/prime and read the pairing directions 3 times (I've had issues with pairing other items in the past) it turns out I could have  read the directions once and would have still paired them right as they connected quickly and easily.  After picking the right size earbuds, they come w/ 4, I tried them on and couldn't believe how great the sound was.  I couldn't hear my husband snoring at all.  The bass was deep but not over powering.  These really allow you to immerse yourself in the music.  So thrilled I decided on these.  They've become my go to set.  Extra bonus, they include a 1 year warranty with registration.

title: The BEST QUALITY-PRICE-VALUE for wireless headphones out there!!!!!
body:
I misplaced my Samsung wireless earbuds and went on Amazon looking for a replacement.  Usually, I don't believe the ratings or hype, but I decided to give these a try because I really can't live without wireless earbuds.  This is a real rating so listen carefully....THESE EARBUDS ARE SIMPLY THE BEST PERIOD!!!  I paired these up with my Samsung phone in seconds, without reading even the quick start guide.  I did glance at the packaging and I noticed that they said WATERPROOF.  Again, I didn't believe it because for sub $50 you don't usually get everything as advertised.  Seeing that Sony, Bose (who I love) and Samsung are selling the same type earbuds with less advertised features for hundreds of dollars more.

Well, I decided to wear these in the shower - since I purchased the Amazon extended warranty I figured if anything goes wrong I am covered.  Well I WAS BLOWN AWAY!!!  They performed flawlessly - hence my long review!!

I am totally satisfied with my purchase and you will be too.  YOU CANNOT GO WRONG WITH THESE EARBUDS!!!

title: Very poor sound, ill fitting
body: For me personally, these wouldn't stay in my ears, and generally don't have a problem with ear buds staying in my ears.  Poor sound quality for this price;  a pair of $14.99 ear buds would be a wiser purchase since they would have comparable sound quality.

title: Amazing earphones!
body: These little earphones pack a punch with great sound and fit perfect. I couldn't be happier with both the earphones and the service I received from the company. Would definitely recommend these to friends/family and am thinking about getting a second pair just because they are so awesome. Thank you!

title: love these ear buds.
body: the fit is perfect. Stay in well. The sound quality is great! I also love that the little case that stores them, also charges them, either by plugging in or wirelessly!!!

title: Much better than I had imagined. Worth trying.
body: At first sight I thought this would be just a regular wireless earbud. I was wrong. The sound is pretty amazing. Connectivity was super easy and worked at the first time I pared with my iphone, computer, and iPad. I can't tell how long the battery last but I can say that I never ran out of power since I started using it. If you are looking for an affordable but yet good quality earbud, this could be an option for sure.

title: Top Quality Company and Products
body: I bought these for my husband as he listens to podcasts. The battery life is amazing, and I cannot hear anything when he is listening to podcasts right next me. They are small, which is good and be aware when they fall out. We did have one of them stop working after 4 months. Since it was past the Amazon return window, I reached out to the company directly and they sent us a brand new replacement set for no charge. The new ones work great! My husband loves them. Tozo provides 100% top customer service!!! I would highly recommend buying not only these earbuds but also from TOZO.

title: Awesome wire free headphones
body:
I was seeking wire free headphones that were not AirPods (apple headphones tend to not stay in my ears). After doing a bit of comparing on Amazon with a few different brands, these looked like the clear winner.

Connection to my phone was simple and not spotty as I walk through the city. I will note that you don't have volume control on these headphones, or the capability to change your song, but this wasn't an issue for me as I have an apple watch and can adjust these things from there. Call quality is good - asked the person on the other end of the phone if they had any trouble hearing me and they didn't.

So far I've done various workouts in these and haven't had issues with them falling out of my ear. I've ran on the treadmill and did a HIIT workout (one that involved a lot of jumping) and had no issues. Make sure you try a few of the ear bud sizes to find your sweet spot.

title: Very Pleased, Highly Recommended
body: I am amazed by the sound quality and overall functionality of mine. These are the first workers ear buds I have purchased and could not be happier. I live being able to charge them in the portable dock on the go. I've used them fir hours and have yet to find out what noise they make to say the battery is getting low. Pairing them with my phone was super easy. I was still trying ti read the pairing instructions and they had already connected to my phone. I would highly recommend these.

title: Great sound!!!
body: Got a pair of these not really knowing what to expect, but they synced up with my iPhone very easily and the sound was very good.  I'm not a music expert but sounded really good me.  The ear fit was very good and if you're like me and cannot wear the airpod type ear bud then this will work for you.  I prefer this style over the others out there.  The Charging case if great and the wireless charging works great.  Overall I'm very satisfied with this purchase and going to order another set for my wife.

title: I use these every day!
body: Love these earphones! I can make and receive calls and be heard easily by the other person. Sounds for music and audio books is outstanding. Range is pretty good. I can still hear even if I leave my phone upstairs and I go downstairs, takes a while to start cutting out. They were easy to set up and connect to my phone. The only negative is the charging case, which is bulky. But the charge seems to last a really long time. Also they are fairly comfortable.

title: I own two pairs of this product & can easily switch between them w/o bluetooth connection problems
body:
I liked this product so much that I bought a second pair.

I carry around 2 pairs of this earbud, and one charging case. When battery gets low, I swap the two pairs -- use the fully charged earbud, and place the low-battery earbud in the charging case. Switching bluetooth connections is very smooth (tested on my Pixel XL).

- For listening to music, the sound quality & bluetooth connections are solid.
- For calling, the mic is too quiet. The other person on the line has trouble hearing me, unless I hold the right earbud next to my mouth.
- Battery life lasts about 2 hours. Since I carry around two pairs of earbuds + one charging case, and swap the earbuds when one of them is low on battery, the battery lasts me all day.

title: IHAD HIGH HOPES
body: I HAD HIGH HOPES. THE PRODUCT WORK PERFECTLY FOR A FEW DAYS THEN THE LEFT EARBUD WENT DEAD THIS IS THE 6 th  BTOOTH SET OF  HEADPHONES . ALL DIFFERENT BRANDS NONE ARE EXPENSIVE .THIS BRAND COST $ 50 IT WAS MONEY WASTED.ICALLED CUSTOMER SUPPORT AND THEY BLEW ME OFF

title: Really Great Product
body: I was looking for not as expensive blue tooth earbuds and these are perfect because they're not too expensive and actually work really well. The battery life seems to last forever and I love them so far. I would definitely recommend.

title: Great fit and sound (Update: superb customer service)
body:
I have been using another earbud system that did not fit me well at all. I am very happy with how this product fits and the quality of the sound, especially at the price.
Update:
After a bit of use I found an issue with the sound quality. After a brief trouble shooting period, the manufacturer arranged for a replacement of the ear buds. The process was quick and painless. This is one of the best customer service experiences I have had.
It seems that the manufacturer is very serious about providing an excellent customer experience!

title: Very pleased.
body: These headphones sound great, especially if you love a powerful low end. The charging case works very good and the battery is average. I can wear these in the shower, but if you choose to, try to not get water directly in the earhole. These fit very well and the adjustable covers are really nice for noise cancelling. These also look great. I am very please with this purchase. Would recommend as a cheaper alternative to overpriced AirPods.

title: Decent choice for waterproof and durable earbuds
body:
I got my T10 earbuds and used them for about a month now, and I am decently satisfied with them. I was looking for wireless, comfortable earbuds that I can use in the shower with an average price - here's my experience with the T10 earbuds so far:

WHAT'S INCLUDED IN PACKAGING
The T10 earbuds came packaged with the following items:
- Left and Right earbuds
- 4 pairs of earbud covers (XL, L, Med, Small)
- Black strap string (I haven't figured out how to tie this to the dock yet)
- Charging dock
- Short micro-usb cable (in case you don't have a wireless charger)
- Manual
- Small note to register my purchase with the TOZO store to claim additional warranty time

SIZE
The earbuds are fairly small in packaging. The dock itself easily fits in the palm of my hand, and the earbuds snap into the dock when placed for charging.

COMFORT
I recently developed a greater sensitivity to earbuds, where if the cover is too big and presses against the sides of my inner ear, it becomes uncomfortable until I'm feeling a consistent headache. Because of this, I'm very picky with the earbuds I choose. For references, I regularly use the JVC HAFR6B Gumy Plus earbuds with the smallest size earpieces, and those work perfectly for me. In comparison, the smallest size earpieces for the T10 earbuds are a snug fit and caused slight discomfort in my ears initially, but my ears adjusted to them over the month.
The larger size earpieces for the T10 earbuds certainly do a better job keeping the earbuds in your ears, but to do so they squeeze against your inner ear to create a tight fit.

For showering, I think they definitely get the job done. I've had multiple experiences where one or both earbuds would fall out while showering, but they seem very durable and were not damaged when they slipped out and fell onto the bathtub floor. I also feel significantly less discomfort in my ears while I shower, so the T10s are more or less exactly what I needed.

CONNECTIVITY
For showering, the T10s offer relatively stable connectivity even while covered in water. I noticed that connections with devices 1 room away does result in consistent stutters, so it's helpful to keep whatever paired device you're using close to you while you wash.

CONS
Changing the earpieces on the T10s can be tedious and difficult, because the earpieces are very tight fits. When changing earpiece covers, don't be afraid of pressing down firmly to get them on.

Overall, I'm happy with my purchase. I will hopefully update this review in 5 months to check on durability.

title: Not for runners
body:
I use the buds for running... extremely short range, maybe a couple of feet. I run with a running belt where I carry my phone. It’s a little aggravating when the music cuts out.  It also occurs when I turn my head.
I have started using these only for walks and working around the house. I have not noticed any appreciable difference in noise cancellation. I’m not certain the product has this capability.

title: Wireless Earbuds with bluetooth
body: I wanted to give the product 5 stars because there is so many positive things. The one drawback is the slave earbud (left side) occasionally has signal loss when I am riding bike with phone in pocket. It didn't matter which pocket (left or right front). Aside from that instance, walking around, working on computer, and streaming online audio - the pair of earbuds work great. I love the different sizes of ear bud options. and the construction and feel of material is excellent.

title: Skeptical buyer amazed
body:
I was always skeptical about buying these Bluetooth headphones because of the ease of losing them. You just have to be careful and mindful of what you do with them. I've had these earbuds for over 90 days now and I do not have any issues.

I had read online that most earbuds are high treble and that wouldn't suit my tastes. But these definitely have bass boosted nicely, without making conversation unclear.

I think I've probably had these earbuds fall out of my ears a handful of times but that was before I actually put the buds in the recommended way.

I workout in these faithfully and only twice have I had to keep one from falling out during cardio.

The battery life isn't long like my Bluetooth over the ear headphones but I also don't have 3 hour long sessions so the battery life is fine. Plus if they start to die, a 5 minute recharge will give you like 30 mins . The recharge time is pretty damn quick too.

title: I love them so much I bought 2
body: These are my 4th pair of Bluetooth headphones and every other brand before these were losing connection they wouldn’t pair right away. Sound was choppy but these work great I have one pair at home and a pair at work!

title: FINALLY earbuds that fit AND sound fantastic!
body: I have THE hardest time finding earbuds that stay in my left ear. I have other wireless earbuds with the clip over the ear, and Apple EarPods with a wire, that do NOT stay in my ears for anything. These actually stay in!  And the sound quality is awesome, especially the bass. It literally booms in my ear and sounds great. I got them in white since my daughter has black ones. The white is very sleek-looking!  I am loving these earbuds!

title: Makes Life SO Much Easier!
body:
I needed wireless earbuds because I do a lot of driving for work but need to answer calls throughout. Unfortunately, my car is rather simple and doesn't have a bluetooth system. I bought an FM transmitter in hopes it would take care of all the problems, but that didn't go well, and I returned it. When these earbuds came in, I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to connect them to my phone and then to set up the charging units. So far, they've been wonderful! Music comes in strong, the pushing of buttons is simple, and they don't fall out even when I'm shaking my head intensely for... no reason.

I only have two areas of concern: 1) even with Spotify tracks, there's a bit of fuzziness in the background, and 2) using the smallest earbud covers, the earbuds end up being a tiiiiiny bit too big for my ears (but then again, maybe I'm the only person in the world with this problem, sigh).

Random note: I will be switching over to an iPhone in a few days, and I'm really hoping these work well with it!

title: Changing my original review to "Great perfomer, fabulous customer service"
body:
I rated TOZO Wireless Earbuds originally with one start and returned purchase because of quiality issues.
Couple of days ago TOZO Customer service contacted me and replaced original purchase with brand new updated version. This like day and night. For less than $50 those headphones sounds more than awesome. Rich bass and outstanstanding full range sound. Of course as with any BT Earbuds even twice more expensive expect sometimes connectivity issues when you make sharp head turn and you streaming device (phone) located in your pants. Charging is fast. Phone quality is in pair with Samsung BT earbuds and Apple AirPods. So I'm changing my rating from 1 start to 5 start because of quality, value and excellent caring customer service. Keep up your awsome job Team TOZO!
===========================================================================================
Lowest quality earbuds. TOZO didn't even include ear cups except ones attached to the ear buds. Forget about bass, only midrange. Left one constantly disconects. Call quality is unexceptable. Returning

title: The last earbuds I will ever buy!!!Very satisfied!!
body: First of all the customer service is AMAZING!!They went above and beyond to resolve an issue!!These have been the best earbuds!The sound is very good quality and I love how convenient the charging box is!I also love that they have held up for almost a year now!!We haven't bought another set of earbuds since we purchased these!!Definitely recommend!!!

title: Great quality for the price!
body: I haven’t had these long, but I am impressed so far. Sound is clear, for us great, and the induction wireless charger aspect to them is really neat. Paired easily, and actually came with a manual.

title: Way better than expected. Highly recommend.
body:
These earbuds are awesome! Great sound, full bass, and importantly, they stay snug in my strangely shaped ear holes where other earbuds normally don’t. I normally have to send other Ill-fitting earbuds back.

 I haven’t tried running in them but they are good for weight lifting.  Noise canceling is just passive.  Not sure about the claim (at least in the instructions) about being able to use them when swimming.  Bluetooth and WiFi don’t transmit through water and as soon as there is any water between your eardrum and ear phone, the sound is absolutely muted.  Good distance for reception, they have held the signal up to 40 ft away.

Highly recommended, especially at this price point.  Definitely keepers!

title: Great upon initial use, but reviews are fake
body: Good so far, but reviews are skewed. The company emails you after purchase and offers a free wireless charger in exchange for a 5 star review which they do not actually give you.

title: Great ear buds at a great price
body: Good purchase experience and great ear buds.  The sound quality is good and they fit great and are comfortable during my fairly active workouts.  The only thing that's a little disappointing is that I have to charge the case more often than I expected, maybe every 3 days.

title: Comfortable wear, easy bluetooth pairing
body: These are the most comfortable bluetooth earbuds I've had yet. They also pair easily with my phone, so no issues getting them to work (which is not always the case with other brands...). On the other hand they seem to be very sensitive to touch - if I just move them slightly while music is playing I sometimes lose it for a second, or hear this uncomfortable noise (but goes right back to normal afterwards). Also, when they say deep bass they mean it - a little TOO strong for me but if you like that you're good. Overall happy with these!

title: Better sound quality and fit than any other earbud or headset I’ve EVER owned!!!
body: I have purchased several wireless earbuds and headsets but NONE compare to the excellent fit, sound quality and noise isolation that these little gems have!!! From the moment I took them out of their charging case, I was impressed.  They paired with my phone and tablet device almost instantly!!  The enhanced bass, ease of use, paring and ability to listen to music or answer calls without picking up my phone, make these earbuds far more superior, than those well-advertised brands that I’ve spent $150+ for in the past.  The TOZO T10 5.0 Wireless Earbuds are an EXCELLENT buy and not only do I highly recommend, I would purchase them again in a heartbeat!

title: Great purchase so far! Would definitely recommend.
body: I really like these earbuds. They sound great and I love the bass which was the one thing I was really concerned about. The battery life is good and they really do cancel out outside noise. I have to turn them off or take them out to hear what people are saying lol. And I love that they are waterproof. I have not had any problems so far and would definitely recommend these earbuds!

title: For $50, Buy Something Better!
body:
I’ve had these earbuds for about three weeks now, and I must say, for what I paid for them, they are terrible! The “sound quality” that’s so highly bragged about, just isn’t there for me. I’ve tried every combination of earbud covers they come with, and they still sound like $5 dollar store earbuds, with  a very tinny, weak tone. I’ve changed my equalizer on my iPhone a dozen, or more times and still can’t fix it. Just a small nitpick on them, and I would have said this even if I had liked them, they look absolutely stupid in your ears! Not low profile, whatsoever. If you lie down with them in your ears, you will have trouble laying on your side, as they protrude around half an inch out of your ears. Now for the real reason for the negative review; THE BATTERY LIFE! The battery life on these earbuds is god-awful! They claim 4 hours on a full charge (if I remember correctly, I didn’t check the listing before writing this) and when you unbox them, the features list on the box claims “a 3 hour battery life”. (Again, I did not check before writing this, however actual product claims hour less than listing here) Instant lie right there, folks. I have seen a MAXIMUM 2 hour life with mine on a full charge and that’s on volume click 4... Not impressive at all. And the “fast charging” feature, is not that quick. 45 minutes to get a full charge. For example, my old $12 Walmart earphones had a max life of 6 hours on a 90 minute charge! What. The. Heck. Problem is, they are very fragile pieces of junk, that crap out from on drop of water. That’s why these aren’t only one star. The water-resistance is really good, so far, and the 4 charge case is really nice, as well.

Bottom line; is if you asked me how much I’d say these are worth, let me use them for two days,then said name the price, I’d tell you $20. Fifty dollars for these is absolutely ridiculous. They are nice, in a couple of ways, but definitely not worth fifty bucks. There’s plenty of WAY better options on here, for that price.

title: Redeeming warranty after 6 weeks
body: The sound is better than most earbuds. It’s loud and has bass. I love that I can’t hear people talking when I am wearing both. I have not tested the waterproof feature. They come with differences sizes for large or small ears. I have to use the smallest ones and still they regularly fall out of my ears. So often my left earbud stopped working. It’s completely unresponsive. It turns on rarely but never connects and always stops working again. After 6 weeks, I am redeeming my replacement. I am willing to get more because I do love these earbuds.

title: They don't stay in your ears.
body: It's a good thing these were water resistant. They have fallen out of my ears into urinals, salads, weight room floors and puddles. Even after buying the foam mold tips they still don't stay in and I shove them in there pretty good. Waste of money.

title: Garbage! Avoid this product!
body: This product stopped working soon after I received it. I couldn't even return or get a refund.

title: Well rounded performance
body: I've had this for about 2 months now and I have yet to encounter an issue with it. I've used it for almost 3 hours of continuous use without recharging. The case is handy and the overall performance of the headphones themselves is satisfactory. They are easy to pair but the only complaint I have is that you cannot control volume or skip songs using the buttons according to the manual at least. Other than that it was worth the money.

title: Perfect budget headsets!
body:
I can't really say much because the left ear bud doesn't work.
EDIT:I contacted Tozo and all I can say is that their customer service is great! They sent me a pair and they work PERFECT. I have not tested battery life, but they are truly waterproof so you can wear them while taking a shower no problem

title: Weak connection between left and right device
body:
The sound quality would be okay IF the left bid did not continually lose signal and quit emitting sound. I am contemplating returning these as I’m disappointed with the connection strength.
Update: TOZO did offer me a new pair of ear buds after my negative review. They told me not to return the old ones which was nice. Then they asked me to update my review even before the replacements arrived due to their goodwill gesture. I told them via email that my review was not for service but rather product quality. Unfortunately the new ear buds have the same issue. I fear that the Amazon reviews have been skewed to show good quality when many people have issues but receive additional product in return for them to improve their review.

title: Very Solid Set of Bluetooth Headphones
body: My office requires bluetooth headsets in a room that is ESD sensitive so I decided to pick these up. I also have a set of $60 wired headphones I planned on using everywhere except for the ESD room but these have quickly become my new favorite pair of headphones. They dont come loose during workouts, they are fully functional in the shower and the range on the bluetooth is pretty unbelieveable. The set comes  with 4 sets of earbuds of varying sizes. I have found that the second smallest set provides a comfortable fit and minimizes external noise. Very satisfied.

title: Range leaves a thing to be desired
body: Sound quality is surprisingly good for a $50 pair of independent wireless earbuds. Bass is really good. Full range frequency response is great. Highs tend to be drowned out by the lows although they do seem to have a "break in" period. Bluetooth range is terrible though. It cuts out with my phone just in my pants pocket similar to early bluetooth headsets from 10 years ago which makes me wonder if it's actually bluetooth 5.0. Both sides are in perfect sync though

title: One Earbud lasts about an hour.
body: I used these earbuds for listening to music at work (8 hours alternating earbuds) and working out at the gym(both earbuds). I have been using these headphones for about 4 months now and the right earbud only lasts about 1 hour and often it randomly connects while it is charging. Overall the earbuds work great just that the battery on the one diminished rather fast compared to normal Bluetooth headphones.

title: Perfect quality . Could be a bit smaller
body: The quality is very good compared to the Apple air pod my old complaint is that it is very large. I thought it would be smaller and less noticeable that’s why I got the close to skin color khaki instead of white or black . I would recommend this over the Apple air pod considering it is less than a third of the price and you get the same quality I hope in the near future they make a less bulky version then it would be perfect

title: definitely a good buy
body: First wireless earbud ever owned - after comparison shopping and some research, i chose these and i have to say i am glad i did. Great sound - good bass and crisp treble. Some issues connecting and pairing first time but could be because didn't read instructions. Reset the buds and they paired and connected with my Android without a hitch. No issues with connectivity on subsequent usages. Pausing the earbuds with the button does not stop the audio play - just mutes it. Have to pause in the app you are listening to if you need to stop playback temporarily. As for fit, these buds are lightweight and one of the 4 sizes of rubber grommets included should keep them in place. I have to push these bud back in now and then but over all they have stayed in place with jogging for 30 min. Recommended purchase!

title: Nice earbuds, but bad sound quality
body: I got these with high expectations, due to all the good reviews, but these earbuds do not live up to it. First off, they are very bulky compared to others and stick out of your ear a lot. Second of all, the when playing music, it is very pitchy and hot on the higher frequency which hurts my ear. The noise cancellation is impressive, but still not happy with it. Do not recommend for people with any care for sound quality.

title: Cool but battery life could be alot better.
body: Overall these headphones are sick!!! Great sound. Had em for a little over a month. Couple of cons. They tend to fall out when excersizing and the battery life is maybe 3 hours tops. Overall, a solid 4 out of 5.

title: Best sound at this price point!
body: The sound is the best I've heard in any headset at this price point. Or maybe even the $100 price point as well. They are incredibly stable in your ears and I love the wireless charging since I can power share from my phone. My only draw back is that I use my headphones all day at work and these dont last the full day without re-docking part way through. Thankfully the case holds a charge as well and the earbuds are juiced up and ready to rock in what seems to be 20 mins or less. All in all I'm very happy with this product!

title: Disappointed, wouldn't recommend
body:
This product only works within 10-15 feet of your device. I can't even clean my house with these in with my phone in one room without the sound totally cutting out. I contacted Amazon and they told me the max range is 15 feet.
I wish I knew that before I bought them as that isn't in the product information and to me it's just as bad as corded earbuds.
The sound is good but I can barely use these!

title: No good
body: I’m giving a 2 stars because the sound is good when it stays in my ears. I tried the 3 sizes and None worked. They keep jumping out from my ears. The noise canceling maybe because it keeps jumping is not good at all. Plus have to charge 2/2 days and I just listen no more than 1 hour music per day. Had a better quality and cheaper one but unfortunately I lost it

title: Great purchase
body: I did not expect much from these wireless earbuds when I first bought them, but I figured that since they were on sale and I needed earbuds I would give them a try. I did not realize how great they were until I received them. They work really well whether you are in the shower or running in the rain, and the only connection issues I had was when I left my phone in my bag. Would highly recommend to anyone in the market to buy wireless earbuds!

title: Left side audio breaks up
body:
These separate earbuds are setup such that the Left Earbud is connected (wirelessly) to the Right Earbud (not the device).  When the earbuds are too far apart, the Left Earbud cuts out.  No problem, right?  You just put them in your ears and that's the only distance to worry about.  Well, it's a problem if the Left Earbud cuts out when they're in your ears.  I proved this by removing the Right Earbud and holding it mid-way across my face.  When I do that, the Left Earbud cuts out.  I'm able to reproduce this by either putting the Right Earbud in my ear, or simply in an outstretched arm.

I've been accused both figuratively and literally of having a big head, but it's silly that the wireless connectivity between the Right Earbud and my phone (in my left pants pocket) is fine, but the connectivity between my ears ... err... between the earbuds in my head is so very, very poor.

Easily the worst money I've spent on headphones, ever.

title: Solid Set of TWB Earphones
body:
I have only owned these earphones for one day (purchased them for $27 on a Lightning Deal), so this "review" is really just my first impressions.  I'll update this review if any issues come up that make me reconsider my feelings on IEMs.  I am not a hardcore audiophile, but I do appreciate quality headphones and earphones.  I'll talk first about my intial impression of the build quality, set up and bluetooth performance and sound quality.

The build quality on these Tozo T2 is pretty darn good.  The case is well made and very solidly assembled.  I have no doubt it can handle a good drop from your pocket onto concrete.  I also don't doubt Tozo's claim that the case has an IPX8 rating (and I usually take those types of claims from chinese manufacturers with huge grains of salt).  The micro USB port on the case is covered by a rubber seal and the case shuts firmly and is held in place by three heavy earth magnets.  The same type of magnets are also used to hold the earbuds in the case when they are charging.  They aren't going to rattle loose or pop out unless you want them to come out.  The earbuds are also really well made.  They have a very solid feel and the plastic doesn't feel cheap at all.  Because of these are TWB earphones, they are not the lightest I have used though and, overall, they feel heavier than typical wired bluetooth IEMs.  This isn't really a big deal, since I had no issue using them through my workout at the gym this morning, including HIIT session on the treadmill and an intense weight training session.  I also tested the Tozo's claims of IPX8 water resistance rating by giving them a wash in the sink and using them in the shower.  The held up just fine and it was nice to be able to listen to my tunes during a shower!!!  This capability makes these earphones perfect for the beach or pool, where you wouldn't risk more expensive and/or delicate earphones.

As for the feature set, I really like the fact that the case for these earphones can be charged using a qi wireless charger.  I could have lived with the micro USB, but this just makes the process of charging the case (and earphones) so much easier!!  On the other hand, these phones have one button on each bud that controls your phone.  Click once and it will pause your music.  Click again and the music will restart.  Those are only media functions these buttons serve.  Other than that, the buttons are used for accepting, rejecting or hanging up on phone calls.  It would have been nice if you could use them to change music tracks and control the volume.  Other earphones in this price range ($40 list price) have these capabilities, but they don't have the waterproof rating or the wireless charging capability.  So, you have to choose what is more important to you.

As for bluetooth connectivity, set up is as easy as everyone claims.  Take the IEMs out the case, they go into pairing mode and connect to each other.  They show up as available on your phone's bluetooth menu, and you click on the right earphone--that's it.  The automatically turn on and connect to the phone when the IEMs are removed from the case.  This makes them very simple and easy to use.  Due to their size (although they are not large by any means), it does take a little longer to get them comfortably situated in your ear than most wired IEMs (bluetooth or otherwise).  This is probably true for most TWB IEMs (with a few exceptions).  Once situated, they do stay where they are suppose to, although you need to make sure you are using the correct sized earphone tips.  The medium sized silicone tips that came pre-installed on the earphones fit me just fine and held the earphones firmly in place.  However, I am currently using a pair a medium sized comply foam tips (they did not come with the earphones), since they are comfortable and hold the earphone securely in place (and create a better seal than silicon tips IMO).

Before I get into sound quality, this is an element that is very subjective.  Although I am not a hardcore audiophile, I care about sound quality and have invested in  some well respected headphones and IEMs (Grado S80s, Audio Technica ATH-M50X, Shure SE425, Tin Audio T2, KZ AOS10 etc)..  I tend to like a earphones that have a fairly neutral sound, but are capable of generating tight controlled base (which can be brought out using the equalizer on your phone or tablet).  These are NOT neutral sounding earphones.  In fact, it sounds to me as if Tozo designed these earphones with a fixed EQ setting that overly emphasizes bass (particularly in the lower and mid range).  This causes the bass to bleed over into the mids.  If you ever listened to a 5.1 surround sound system where the subwoofer's crossover is set too high and at too high of a volume (creating that booming/overwhelming sound), these earphones have that effect.  There is also some sibalence in these earphones--far from the worst I heard, but it is definitely present (especially for female vocals).  These are earphones that are tuned for bassheads, but the 8mm drivers used by Tozo don't have the chops to really deliver clean quality bass.  Tozo would have been better off not trying to put a fixed EQ setting in these earphones and left them with a balanced setting, which anyone can tweak to their taste using the EQ on their phone.

In short, these are NOT the best sounding earphones I have ever heard.  The sound quality is on par with a set of wired Philips Extra Bass headphones that you can buy for $15 at CVS or Rite Aid (which is they type of earphone that most people use).  What makes them special is the fact that for $39 ($27 if you got them on a lightening deal), ,these earphones are rugged TWB earphones that are waterproof, come with a waterproof case that also serves as wireless charging base, and is, itself, capable of being charged with a Qi wireless charger.  They aren't going to replace my Shure SE425, but they will compete with my superior sounding Tin Audio T2 (which I have connected via an MMCX Fiio bluetooth cable) for time at the gym and certainly during the summer at the beach and pool.  I don't have much experience with other TWB earphones, but it doesn't seem like Tozo's competitors are offering anything significantly better in the sub-$50 range--so this is about as good as it gets for now (I am sure things will be much different in a year or two).

title: The reviews are right, these are awesome!
body: Usually ear buds fall out of my ears and I have to hunt down replacement rubber ends for them. The Tozo buds came with multiple options. They’re comfortable and easy to operate. The first time I tried my favorite playlist, I was absolutely amazed. It was like being in my own sound bubble. The bass and sound quality are great. My friend was talking to me with both buds in, I didn’t hear a thing. No pain as of yet from extended wear. Great product! Also, I’m so happy that these didn’t break the bank like most wireless headphone/earbud options

title: Defective Left Earbud (2nd update)
body:
Sound kept dropping out in the left earbud.  Not sure whether it was a bad Bluetooth connection or a short in the earbud. Battery life was right at the 3 hour life as advertised. I am sure this would have gotten worse over time.  I returned the product after using two times.

07/24/19 update: Vendor contacted me and offered to send me a new set of earbuds free of charge to test and review. I am revising my original one star rating to three stars for good customer service. Hopefully the new earbuds will deserve a much higher rating.

08/04/2019 update: I received the new earbuds on Tuesday, July 30th. After fully charging them and pairing them to my Samsung Galaxy S8 phone, I used them on my exercise walk the following morning. Unfortunately, within less than a minute of starting my walk, the left earbud started losing the signal and continued to do so for the next five minutes of me trying to get them to work. After 5 minutes, I gave up and turned them off and put them in my pocket. For those that are wondering, I wear my phone in an armband on my left arm, so distance to the phone is certainly not the issue. Just to be sure that the problem was not related to my phone, I paired the earbuds to my wife's IPod and tried again to walk with them while listening to music. The problem continued to happen with the iPod, so I know the earbuds are defective. Because of this, I am reducing my product rating back to one star. I appreciate the company trying to make me happy, but I am unable to endorse their product.

title: Pretty impressed for the price
body: I've owned Jaybird X2s for a while and while those headphones were nice, they were always a pain to charge and keep track of. These TOZO T10s are sleek and comfortable and offer an impressive sound quality for their price. Even without ear grips, these headphones have no issue staying in my ears and with extended wear, I don't feel any irritation. Definitely recommended.

title: Awesome sound and battery life
body: Connect very easy. Awesome sound. Sound quality better than Air pods.  Stay in place while working out, running, and doing yard work

title: I am surprised!
body: First off these have so much bass!!! These sound like Beats or even Sony headphones! They are better than AirPods in my Opinion because they have more bass than AirPods. The case is really small and really portable. You can put these in your pocket easily. I love how portable these are! The battery life is very good. They are very noise insulating, which is good for keeping out noise. They come with extra ear tips if you lose some. They fit pretty well and don’t fall out.

title: Awesome earbuds!
body: Outstanding earbuds!  I do a lot of outside work with loud equipment and I couldn’t be happier with the sound and noise cancellation feature. Battery life is at least 5 hours. I’ve never lost sound due to battery.  If your looking for comfortable buds that sound incredible - look no further. These are what you want.

title: Premiere Personal Listening Product at a Premium Price
body: The Tozo T10 Earbuds turned out to be just as advertised and are high-quality, comfortable and very durable. I read the reviews prior to my purchase and was pleasantly surprised that the hype about these inexpensive earbuds was spot-on. I rarely give a 5-star review, but I don't think you could get a better earbud for the price. The earbuds come with multiple sizes of earbud covers that will ensure comfort to most users (unless someone has extremely tiny or oversized ear canals. Great sound, great call quality and great battery life.

title: Price VS Quality is amazing!
body: You might be thinking that since these are cheaper than those AirPods or whatever they're called, that these are no good; but, you would be wrong! These earbuds are amazing, as I've put them to the test in a real workout many times already. Great sound, great battery life, really everything is just as advertised. Get you a pair — you'll be glad you did!

title: Ability to use buds independently is a real plus
body:
Decided to try these out. As other reviewers have noted - the ability to independently use the buds or together is a real plus for me.
