body: Overall very good headphones. I have enjoyed these for the first month I have had them. Long battery life and have even been able to shower with them. The microphone has a bit of trouble picking up my loud voice for calls, so I hold one in front of me when someone can't hear. For everything else, five stars.

title: These earbuds raise the bar
body: After researching for months, I bought these when they came up as a deal. I have not been disappointed. The sound is great. I adjusted the sound settings on my phone (Galaxy S7) to simulate a tube amplifier and the bass is great! I've used them for 2-3 hours at a time at moderately high level with no battery life issues. They pair consistently and have decent Bluetooth range. I would definitely buy them again.

title: General functionality
body: First, if you have  more than one device that you have paired with this product, beware. It will constantly try to pair, and tell you it is connected  wih both deices, but it will not work. Once it gets confused, it is an effort to ever get it to re-connect. An aggravating and dangerous task if you are driving. In my case, an Iphone and Ipad in the car together. It simply cannot do this. In addition, the left channel problems are real. Seem to be when the source device is in close proximity, it is as tho the left channel want to pair directly  with the device, rather than the right earphone.  I am returning.

title: Great stationary- not so great active earbuds
body: These are wonderful for stationary work, but terrible for walking/active use. The sound becomes cut up and choppy the second I put my phone in my back pocket or tuck it into my waist band while walking. Returning them.

title: Great Earbuds for A Great Price!
body: So I've been trying to find good Bluetooth earbuds for awhile now and I came across these. The earbuds had great reviews and were only $50. To me that is a great price for Bluetooth earbuds. I was completely right. The sound quality is great for $50. They are easy to use and fit perfectly in my ear. I thought that they might fall out but I was wrong. I workout with these all the time and they have never fallen out. The charging case it comes with is also very handy, with a long lasting battery life. Overall I think these are one of the best Bluetooth earbuds you can get for the price.

title: Great product Very Satisfied
body:
I am very impressed with these ear buds, they are light weight and fit in my ear very well and do not fall out. Buds come with several sizes of soft silicone tips to find a great individualized fit. They pair to each other incredibly fast and to my phone very quickly as well. The sound quality is great with good bass and clear treble. I listen to both spoken words with pod casts and music and both come in crisp and clear.
I have not tested the waterproof capability but do not plan to listen while showering or swimming so I am not very concerned with that. The only suggestion I have is to include volume control on the ear bud - controlling this from my phone is no problem though. Great product and I am very satisfied.

title: Great sound quality, fit, and high quality
body: As a regular bike commuter, who rides in all kinds of weather, I need a comfortable, noise reduction, and high-quality sound earbuds.  These fit the bill wonderfully!  The sound is amazing and makes me feel like I'm sitting in my living room listening to music through sound speakers.  I found I could customize the fit with the supply of ear cushions.

title: 4.5...but Amazon won't let me put that
body: I really like the sound from these earbuds. They're clear with a decent amount of bass. My only complaint is that you can only pause/play music and answer/hang up calls from the earbud itself. My other one I can skip tracks by double pressing the right one and go back by double pressing the left. Other than that they're great for the price. I really like that they have wireless charging...that feature is cool but doesn't really help me when I'm listening to music and want to change the track. I got wireless earbuds for a reason...and unless I'm wearing my watch, I have to get my phone and change tracks..I guess it's a minor inconvenience but an inconvenience nonetheless.

title: Love these earbuds!
body: I love these! I usually have trouble finding earbuds that fit properly because they're too big, but it comes with different sizes so you can adjust it. The sound is great! I no longer need to worry about dropping my phone every few minutes at the gym because these are completely wireless. The sound does cut off sometimes if there are a lot of people at the gym. These are my first bluetooth earbuds and not too expensive. Overall they work great and they don't fall out if they're put on properly, which was a concern I had when looking for what to get. Highly recommended.

title: They're actually awesome
body:
At first I was kinda skeptical, I thought you can't get good quality earbuds at a fraction of the price, but I decided to give it a try, considering the good reviews, and I'm glad I did ....
This things are super awesome, and super easy to use, u just pull them out and start listening to music, automatically connects, automatically pairs, they even hold perfectly, like Apple headphones always fall out of my ears, I thought ima have to try a few of the rubbers they provide till I get the right fit, nooooo, they actually fit perfectly the way the came, didn't have to open the box with the cable and the rubbers cause the case itself works with wireless charger, so basically that's all u need, no cables whatsoever, 2 earbuds and one little case, how awesome is that???
Oh,And the sound quality, I like how one earbud keeps playing music while the other lets you know someone is calling or that the battery goes low, it's like 3D sound, or something like that
I sincerely recommend this product and trust me, you'll love 'em

title: Absolutely worth it!
body:
Great buy!
Good quality from the box to where it came in to the material used to make the charger box. I’m extremely impressed with it. I would expect this from Bose or those expensive earbuds. Well done Tonzo

Sounds amazing. Easy to use. I have a weird shape ear so normal earbuds won’t stay in. This will. I skip rope, run and hit the box. They stay in as long as you don’t knock them off they lll stay in.

Sound is great,  lots of base and ccrystal clear.

title: Sound is great! So far so good!
body:
Headphones come in a convenient charging case. The sound is amazing And very easy to pair to my iPhone. I have had for a couple days so I will update my review after about a month. I look forward to my new headphones!
EDIT: I have been getting tons of complaints saying that people cannot hear me when I’m using them on a phone call! It’s really annoying especially because I mostly use them so I don’t have to be attached to my phone.

title: Solid wireless blue tooth ear buds!
body: This is my second pair, the first I left on a vacation.  I was happy with them and price was reasonable so I purchased again.  At first I was worried because they would not stay in my ears but I simply changed out the rubber ear pieces and they stay in perfectly.  I lift weights and run with them.  I have no problems with them coming out.  No issues with sweat or water.  Sound is great, bass is very noticeable and battery life is good.  They work perfect for me!  Oh, I also used them on the air plane and helped keep out ambient noise a lot like my more expensive noise cancelling.

title: Really good for the price
body:
I got these a few months ago. For the most part they have been really good. I often use them when I am working out with no problems. In areas that have a lot of signals (other bluetooth devices or otherwise) sometimes sound cuts out, particularly on the lefthand side. Generally the only time I've experienced this however is at work (I work in a QA lab that has hundreds of devices online at the same time in close proximity).

Sometimes the audio is out of phase. Sometimes it doesn't pair or turn of upon taking the device out of the charging case, but it's easy enough to cycle power and after that it's fine.

Overall I'm pretty happy with them. They are cheap and they get the job done.

title: Very Nice--but not great for running
body: I like this for weight lifting at the gym as I don't have to constantly keep picking up my phone (as I would with wired ear buds).  The sound is great.  But when I run, I hear my heart beating in my ears, and my footsteps echo loudly in my ears, so it's a lot of noise.  I like these.  They're easy to use; I just don't like running with them, so I end up brining two pairs of ear buds to the gym.

title: You will know this is a quality product as soon as you see, hold and use them.
body: The TOZO T10 has a beautiful design and the earbuds are very comfortable for hours of use. The sound is awesome with the deeper bass. There are four sizes of caps, so try all for the best fit. Not sure why the xl are different but worked just fine for me. I have used these earbuds working in the yard, at the gym, walking and shopping, never having to readjust. With the sound level high, the world is tuned out. Lower levels one can have a conversation without raising one’s voice. Having the storage case as a charger is genius. Overall, I am really pleased with my purchase and highly recommend them.

title: Thank youuuuuuu!
body: I was cautious about these but boy am I happy! I have tiny ears and I didn’t think they’d stay but they do 🥰 the smallest ear bud works it’s like a suction cup you have to wiggle them it’s and it’s game over. Great sound quality and nice charging case. I haven’t tried swimming in them but it’s cool that they’re waterproof! Mine is black ❤️

title: if it doesn't stay paired, either one bud to another AND/OR to phone right next to your person...
body:
CAN IT BE WORTH KEEPING?
----------------------------------------
<preface this review noting the following was gleaned with over 1 month of usage, on 2 different units, as the inital order was VERY susceptible to cutting out/losing phone pairing. Hardly worked at all, actually – just enough that i liked the potential and opted for a replacement to see if something got past QC...whatever form QC takes for Tozo>

<second context provider: this is the only pair of wireless ear buds i've ever used. it's easy to see on Amazon, as well as crowd-funded sites, that this form-factor is the currently, predominate iteration. case/dock that serves as recharger; buds very close, if not exactly the same, shape and general layout; claims of Bluetooth 5.0 and typically IPX6, 7 or 8, although these T10s are the only IPX8 rated i recall seeing.>

<CAVEAT each and every one of us really should keep in mind as we happily shop away online, wherever that may be: WHO or WHAT centralized agency, reputable or not, is testing and certifying these products?
by exactly what measure is it that products are found to actually be and do what the things "marketing" indicates is so? Hmmm???...lets think on that for a moment...instead of blindly swallowing whatever hook is cast before us and then complaining that we've a hook embedded in our mouth.

that said – IDK where to go to get reputable answers to the obvious questions regarding online (only, typically) product in 2019. if someone does, please post under this review cos I damn sure would like to explore that further.
moving along to this item...>
-------------------------------------------
it is unfortunate, really – as otherwise, there is MUCH to like about this ear bud set up:

* the price was outstanding, at least for this purchase as it was made during a lightning/gold box – whatever Amazon calls their countdown-timed deal opportunities. in my case, it was $29.99. what i paid is actually the teetering point for me as my inner-monologue vacillates between "when they work, i really do like these...and they were astoundingly inexpensive" to "when they cut-out or lose bud-to-bud pairing, no price compensates for resulting escalation of irritation to aggravation..." but as far as evaluating on price relative to sound, feature set and (mostly present) functionality +2

* surprisingly good sound, incl much more low-end than was expected, particularly as one ought remember, they're wireless, fairly small form, ear buds. think about that for a moment...personally, i'll put them firmly between a good set of cans and any of my wired buds, of which i have a half-doz, incl some decent Sony's and a set of Bose sports – granting the Bose are not in-ear buds; which makes a CONSIDERABLE difference in sound quality, as well-fitted in-ear buds both better block outside noise and seal desired audio's path, directing toward the eardrums. +2

*voice calls show well, both from the send and receive side. i have one colleague who routinely complains about calls made either through my car's bluetooth-connected system (mic is in steering wheel) or the now out-of-production Jawbone Icon – yet he's made no comments about my use of these buds, which tells me they're doing the job and then some. i have also made calls to other parties, for the purposes of testing call quality, and no one has observed any issues. my ability to hear and communicate effectively has been surprisingly good, although i haven't yet tested the buds on a call driving down the road with the windows open, or through a call standing outside on a windy day. the Jawbone did a pretty nice job with purported, military-grade noise-cancellation; not sure what/if considerations are employed to that end in these T10s. +1.5

* fit/form is comfortable and stays in place – albeit w/o any running around. my most active conditions involve wearing while operating a residential, riding mower over uneven terrain, getting on/off, sweating were the most vigorous, operational conditions. they can droop some, and they do get a bit uncomfortable after a couple of hours, but then, show me some ear-buds that don't. +1

* battery life was good (roughly 3-hrs) and the recharge time (via an unplugged, but charged, case/dock) seemed to be about 45-minutes in very generally observed times. IOW, i did not run down the buds, break out the stopwatch, note start/stop times; just looked at the clock when initiating recharge and then again when lifted. +1.25

* i get that this form-factor—charging a case/carrying buds in case for on-the-go, cord-free recharging, IS the way these many, many iterations of wireless, BT earbuds are presently made—can't really be attributed to Tozo, but the functionality of the "case as charger" has real value. specific to this case, Tozo appears to use rare-earth magnets, resulting in small form and commensurately strong magnetism. very good for keeping that lid closed and your buds in the case where they belong. i've had my case hanging on my technician's toolbag for a couple of weeks now and have yet to find the lid opening on its own, or of course, my buds out of the case other than when i pull them out. the buds themselves are magnetically drawn into the form and onto the charging contacts, once you've got them most of the way inserted. +1.25

SUGGESTED IMPROVEMENTS:

*most necessarily, and glaring, is the frequent and random connectivity drop: some times it was the Rt-ear (phone pairing) bud from the phone, despite the phone's proximity sitting next to me in my mower's cup holder or in my front shorts pocket, ALWAYS on my right side. other times, it was Lt-bud connectivity loss to Rt-bud, despite the buds having recent charge. this happens FAR TOO FREQUENTLY and does so while they're worn – making it an obvious engineering/technical flaw. Surely the distance through a human's head is so similar that nailing down electronics appropriate to afford solid connectivity across this distance and through incredibly similar material (flesh/bone/brain/bone/flesh) or around the same, should be made certain before this product hits market.
add the pairing drop that i easily—with about 90% consistency reproduced—initiated by tightly cupping an ear with one hand...now that i type this, would seem the bud-to-bud pairing is made with shockingly short-range/weak electronics. so, forget going through the head, these have trouble going AROUND the head and are interrupted by nothing more than the composition of an ungloved, human hand and some of the time, nothing more than...air?
back to the drawing board or lab, Tozo... -5.5

presuming that deal-breaker gets corrected, next suggestion is

* add a feature that makes it clear that the buds are fully charged. update the voiced component to include current battery-life status, or put a meter on the case that provides visual status of the same, or change that LED series (essentially serves as a meter, but with 4-LEDs lined up vs a numeric display) from blue to green, or even better, have the earbuds' go from red to green? there is no way to know how much life left the buds have, other than the voice prompt that kicks in and repeats 3 or 4 times that the battery is low. the auto power-off function comes pretty swiftly thereafter, which is fine, but outside of this, the user has no way to know the buds current, charged state of being. this is kind-of irritating, really.
as it is, appears the display times out. If the buds are lifted from the charging case with a full charge (?), the buds change to blue. Put them right back in the case, they revert to red and sit that way until timing out – unless the battery life is so erratic/poor that a full-charge isn't really a full-charge, or is until lifted from direct charge contact, or...see what i'm saying, Tozo? -1.5

Nit-picky suggestion here, but valid all the same:

* make the charging case/dock's molded loop a wee bit larger. not sure what Tozo expects would be looped through this, but it is too small—without modification—for anything other than a string. i have several cables w/screw-together, end crimped connectors that are typically used for/found in; keeping together keys. the 1/8"  threaded end of this cable would not fit through the loop. i took a very small, sharp utility knife and shaved off little bits of plastic on the case-side (not the loop-side) of the loop, until i was able to get the threaded end of my cable's connector through the opening.
my workaround now ensures i can easily and securely attach the buds' case to a carabiner, a tool bag, a belt-loop (although haven't done that), etc. -1

RESULTS: with this highly unscientific and also highly arbitrary summary of my Tozo T10 observations, based on just a a couple of week's sporadic usage with the initial purchase, followed by several, much more intensive weeks now with the "replacement" unit...it's a wash.

would i say to someone who doesn't already have a strong interest in wireless, ear-buds, "rush out and buy these"?
i would not.
would i encourage someone to try this or a different maker to see if another has defeated the paramount and absolutely necessary condition of consistent and persistent pairing to both phone and bud-to-bud? sure, why not – return them in within the appropriate time frame if they're no bueno.

what's to say that should i go to and through a third set of Tozo's T10s they'd not work splendidly? seems unlikely, but...or that another manufacturer has nailed some technical shortcoming and consideration that appears to have eluded Tozo's grasp? w/o going down that road, can't know.

for me, relative to my specific instance and most definitely considering the price paid and approximately 80% up-time in which the buds work as expected, coupled with already having backup, alternatives if/when the T10s get too exasperating, i'll probably just keep them. reach out to Tozo–if that's even possible w/o further time-suck as has been already been spent in grappling the issue, contacting Amazon multiple times to correct some bizarre-to-me SNAFU in which reviews for this product were disallowed due to (my paraphrased summary here) some goofiness with reviews and legitimate account, product purchases and now the subsequent, even-further time-suck of typing out this loooong overview...but roll the dice and pay full price ($49.99 as of this review's post)...nah.

i suspect the technology is suuuuper close, but just isn't.quite.there.yet to pull off what is trying to be done with the wireless ear-bud market.

title: Bad Quality Music
body: Rarely do I leave a bad review, but I was so disappointed at the quality. $5 earbuds from Walmart sound roughly the same. Not worth even half what I paid, so I'm returning. Two stars because they did provide multiple sized buds and seem like they'd be decently water resistant. Still-would not recommend buying.

title: Got wet one time and died right after return window closed
body: Worked great for a month, got wet one time and the right earbud completely died; the red light stays dimly lit and will not connect or produce any sound.

title: Best earbuds i've purchased
body: These are the best earbuds i've purchased.  I was contemplating on buying the airpods, but decided to look around for a bit.  Im glad i decided to wait on the airpods, because these are awesome.  The sound and bass are amazing. They come with 4 sets of ear cushions, so you can use the ones that best fit your ear shape.  I definitely recommend these earbuds, and will be buying more for my family.

title: Fantastic sound and total comfort.
body:
Fantastic earbuds!  I have been through 4 different brands of earbuds and these are far superior to the others. The sound is crisp and clear whether talking on my iPhone or listening to music. The bass will wow you! But tops on my list of “wows” is how comfortable they are. I forget I am wearing them, and then my phone rings!
Thank you Tozo for a superior product.

title: Impressed!  These things are awesome!
body:
I was on the market for a new pair of headphones, i've tried all kinds of headphones in the past and wanted to give a pair of fully wireless earbuds a shot.  I tried a pair of airpod looking earbuds once that had great reviews (I later found out they were fake... come one Amazon) but threw them away after two days. Even though I was a little hesitant I decided to give the Tozo T10s a shot and ordered them.

The packaging is nice and includes a 3" x 3" guide that includes wearing steps on one side and pairing steps on the other.  Pairing is easy, as soon as you take the earbuds out of the case, they power on.  You then just pair the right earbud to your device and the left will automatically pair.  The case is also really nice, there are magnets on the top of the lid and on the case itself so when closing the case you get a pleasant snap when the two sets of magnets attract each other.  The earbuds sit nicely in the case and are also held in by magnets so the charging elements on the case and earbud make good contact.

There are are four blue LEDs in the case to signify the charge level that blink as the charging case is being charged.  When the earbuds are charging a red LED is visible on the earbud.  There are two ways to charge the case, either through the included micro USB cable or wireless charging.  The actual case itself can be charged wirelessly if placed on a charging mat which I love and such an awesome feature for the price!

The main reason I chose these was because they are completely wireless.  I run three times a week are started out just using the wired headphones, the wires became annoying, so I ordered a pair of wireless sports headphone that just have a wire connecting each earphone.  They were good but the wire still bothered me. My second run using these headphones was a sweaty 11 miles and I had no issues whatsoever, not having to adjust the headphones was awesome.

In summary these earbuds are great, for the price the features are amazing, they are comfortable and sound great.  Definitely recommended!

title: Great for wireless calls.
body:
I'm a realtor and need wireless headphones that work well and are discreet. I've had these for a little over a month and haven't had any issues with calls. Everyone can hear me clearly.

Outside of work, I love wearing them to the pool (no they don't work underwater, but no bluetooth signal can), to the shower and gym. They dont fall out, no matter how much cardio and jumps I do. I've gotten. Them wet multiple times with no issues.

The two negatives I have ( but don't warrant losing a star) are that they don't auto connect to my phone when turned on, and if you walk away and there's a wall between them and the phone, it'll start to cut out.

title: Are not made for dancing...
body:
Terrible. I have been testing it with multiple devices. iPod, Galaxy Note8 and TV. Certainly you can't commute with it if you are MOVING... my lower half moves and the audio continues to cut off and come back.
I tested it with the phone and iPod... you have to keep your device steady in order to keep the audio playing without interruptions. I'm so dissatisfied with this purchase. I wanna dance with this but you can't keep your device in your pocket because it can't keep up with your movement and the connectivity of the earphones. Don't recommend.

title: Heavy bass headphones
body:
TLDR: Too much bass and/or weak treble, and design shortcomings take away a star, but overall a good set of earphones.

The sound quality of these earphones are decent, but the low-end either overcomes the high-end, or the earphones just don't produce the high-end well. The overall sound is a little muddy due to this, but if you like bass you probably won't be disappointed.

Both earphones are the same, meaning you can wear either in either ear. I use them individually often, so this is a bonus for me as I usually prefer my left ear being clear. They do beep for a bit if you try to use them individually, but if you do it right they only beep for a short while.

On the initial charges, I am getting well over 3 hours of play time.

The earphones fit comfortably into my ears, but be careful to choose the right tip. The function button on the earphones is mechanical, meaning you have to press it to activate. The button is very stiff, so you have to press pretty hard, and if you aren't careful, you will be shoving the earphone deeper into your ear, which can be painful. After a few tries you can figure out how to press the button without jamming the earphone into your ear canal.

The pairing and bluetooth signal strength are both good. I haven't had any issues pairing, both as a pair and singularly, and I consistently move 2 rooms away, 25-30 ft through 2 walls, and haven't had any issues with the signal cutting out.

The case is simple and straightforward. It has a charge level indicator, but no way to activate it unless you plug in a charging cable, which is a flaw. I don't use any wireless charging pads so I can't test that function.

The microphone tested okay. It picked up the audio at a decent volume, and wasn't garbled or muffled. I tested multiple times, and each time it seemed to glitch just for a half second every single time, but overall it worked well enough.

In comparison of these earphones to the iKanzi X9, and the Enacfire E20, these would rank number 2 on my list. These Tozo brand earphones sound much better than the iKanzi ones, which had no bass at all, but the iKanzi was overall much better designed and had better features. The Enacfire E20 has all the awesome features and great design of the iKanzi, AND has the best sound out of all three. I would pay a little more and go with the Enacfire E20 earphones.

title: Bad Bluetooth *EDITED*
body:
The unfortunate problem I encountered with these earbuds was that they would constantly lose connection with whatever I had them paired with. Even if it were just my phone in my pocket, my music or podcast would intermittently stop. This would happen pretty frequently, too, making for a rather annoying experience. The sound quality was actually pretty good, but again, the bluetooth capabilities were not great. The battery seemed to drain rather fast, too. These should be more accurately priced around $20 in my opinion.

EDIT* - I have been contacted by TOZO and they are offering to replace the earbuds at no expense to me. The customer service has been very accommodating, and if the new earbuds arrive in working condition I will gladly give them 5 stars.
EDIT** - I received my replacement pair of headphones from TOZO at no cost and they work perfectly. The first pair of headphones I got were defective and the new pair works great. Great customer service, too.

title: Great headphones will buy again
body:
They are lightweight and don't fall out while working or working out. Great sound quality and noise cancelation. I use these at work everyday.
EDIT
After several months of owning these earbuds I had an issue with one of the earbuds. Tozo offered to send me a replacement at no charge. Fantastic customer service!

title: Great fit!
body: I ordered these earbuds so I could listen to music in my slow working time. I was really happy when I opened the box and saw the quality of the product. The sound is amazing with clear bass and well define upper register. At the time I write this review, I can only say that I didn't get to the end of the battery life and did not use the charge that the case carries. I am more than happy to recommend this product as it has great sound, fits perfectly, and has a charge that exceeds my need.

title: Worked great for awhile
body: I really liked these when I first got them.  Sound quality was pretty great, and they paired flawlessly.  However, within a week they began to unpair the left side every few minutes.  So sound would turn off, then only come in through the right side, and then slowly fade back in on the left.  This happened while I was working out 3 feet from my phone so I'm pretty sure I wasn't out of range.  I returned them and requested a new pair.  I'll update this review if the new ones turn out better.

title: Skip the cost of AirPods!
body: I love these earbuds! The shape of many versions over the years (non-wireless) made my ears sore. These are a great fit with several size options, and the noise canceling feature is outstanding. I had considered buying AirPods, but didn’t want to spend that much money. I have no idea what they would give me that the TOZO version doesn’t provide. A great price and great quality.

title: I love my Tozos!
body: As you can see in the photo above, I attached my Tozo case to my purse so I could tuck it inside and not worry about losing it. They come FULLY charged so you don't have to wait to enjoy them and they are a WONDERFUL purchase in both value and quality. I work in a call center that can have a lot of downtime between calls and was able to use mine since I received them on 4/21 and didn't have to charge them again until 4/26. I would say that was with frequent and heavy use. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND these earbuds!

title: FANTASTIC SOUND AND GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE
body:
I don't normally leave reviews but i had to for these little beauties. The sound quality is fantastic with no bleed through from the world around me. Once I found the right cup size for my ear they just popped right in with no discomfort and no independent movement from the ear puds at all. I haven't used them long enough to test the battery life yet but so far I have very happy with them.
EDIT: I've been using these for about a month or so now and the battery life more than meets my needs.
The left ear bud developed an issue where it would randomly and frequently disconnect from the right side. i looked into it and it seems this is an issue with a very small percentage of users. HOWEVER I contacted the company and they are sending me a new set right away. Overall I am still very satisfied. Fantastic sound quality and great customer service.

title: bad  sound quality
body: Now sure how these got such good reviews. They sound terrible. I got Otium earphones and sent them back because i thought there was something wrong with them, but then these were the same. I compared them to Anker liberty air earphones, which are 60$, and they were alot better. i would avoid

title: Broken left earbud
body: They sound great and do a very good job of noise cancelling. It sounds like I'm standing in an empty room and all you can hear is your music playing, even when I'm at the busy gym with the gym's loud music playing.  However, the left ear piece constantly cuts out then fades back in and crackles occasionally as well. Even when I'm holding my phone right next to them. I did that just to make sure I wasn't interfering with the connection somehow. I have sent for a new set. If they work without a problem I will be very pleased. I will keep them at 4 stars because of the hassle of returning them.

title: Amazing headphones and price is great too!
body: I bought these headphones after reading all of the great reviews and they were all correct. These are great headphones. I was surprised on how loud they can get and how comfortable they are. Pairing was easy as well. If you are looking for headphones, these are your best bet!

title: Good Solid Bluetooth Earbuds, a bit bulky but overall performance is great!!!
body: I'm using these for both work and play super excited that I can listen to music and talk on the phone at the same time my Android phone. They do take a bit of getting used to and too much head movement will cause them to fall out, so no head banging or sudden movements but effective for relaxing phone calls and listening to music.

title: A very decent value.
body: Decided to take a chance on these because the Hint was not performing as well anymore.  They arrived rather quickly.  Pairing happened nearly effortlessly.  After sorting through a couple of the ear gels the sound quality heard by me and the sound quality heard by others on calls cleared up greatly.  Sound quality is good on various music and podcast listening.  The only slight downside that I have noticed is the relatively short range of the bluetooth connection.  Other than that, overall a good set of wireless earbuds.

title: Great value
body:
These things are fantastic! Once you get the size figured out they are exactly as promised.
I read one review about interfearence, I have had zero problems in a busy gym with that. One other thing, I walked clear to the other side of the gym and left my phone at my last station. I was clear in the locker room before they started to loose signal. At least 80 feet. Very impressive!

title: Amazing
body: MY FAVORITE wireless/Bluetooth headphones ever. I use these when I’m riding my motorcycle and I’m surprised at how well these work. The noise cancellation is excellent and I’m still able to listen to my music without interruption. On major highways at top speeds the earbuds didn’t even move. The only minor downside is that you’re unable to change songs via headset which was able to do.

title: A Bit Disappointed
body:
A bit of a let down for me because of no control features and staticky.  This is one of the best sounding earbuds on it's price point.

Th Pros:  Great sound with deep bass.  Slightly better than AirPods.  Really nice and deep base.
  I oredered the white cersion.  Nice and sleek look
  The case is very nice.
  Loudness is very good. My phone's volume is at 50% for comfortable listening.

The Cons: No control features to forward or rewind
  No volume adjustment.
  When i put my phone in my pocket during walks or running, the earbuds keeps disconnecting.  Something
  I've experineced from my older version of Bluetooth earbuds (3.0 & 4.0)
  Not so good during phone calls.  The other person on the other line could not hear me and told me that I
  sounded too far from the phone and muffled.

title: Works great
body: Had some initial trouble syching up but it was user error on my part. Read the directions beforehand and there should be no issues

title: Deep Bass - great sound
body: Product was the best out of 18 earbud types that I test and inexpensive too. It really doesn't cancel any noise but blocks external sounds from entering the ear due to the different sizes of inserts you can use to ensure a perfect fit.

title: They fit really well
body:
These totally wireless earbuds are great! I love that they're waterproof and the sound is fantastic! I would definitely recommend this product:)
Christy

title: Not Working After One Week
body: Rare for me to leave a product review but sadly in this case I felt it was warranted.  Initially, a very positive experience with these earbuds - nice packaging and design.  As others noted, recharging case is a little on the plasticky side but it does the job.  Set up was straightforward with my iphone (although read instructions about just pairing right earbud).  Overall, sound quality was pretty darn good - particularly in the bass range.  Apart from some occasional syncing issues with the left earbud, the first week went great until it didn't.  Left earbud issues increased until it just stopped working altogether.  I'll be sending these back and verdict is still out on whether I'll do an exchange or go in another direction.

title: Impressive performance after only 48hrs.
body:
Recently purchased and I'm impressed after 48hrs if heavy use. These paired very easily with my Samsung Galaxy S10 Plus. Love that I can use either the Right ear bud solo or both together.  Mostly, used to listen to music. Even with just the single Right ear bud in, the sound is rich and clear.
Talking throught them via phone calls is great. Clear on both ends of the conversation.
I'd definitely recommend these to my friends and family.

title: Glad I bought
body: I’m very pleased

title: Decent, but has issues
body:
Pros
Good sound quality but nothing to write home about
Very, very loud. I normally run headphones at around 75% volume, these are closer to 50%
They come with different sized plugs so getting one that fits your ear even while running will be easy, unless you're Dumbo or Voldemort
Battery life on charger is decent. You can charge the buds around 3 times. Also the wireless charging is a nice addition

Cons
Battery life is advertised so can't really fault them for that but still wants something to be desired
No next or previous song control on the device which can be a pain. If you're listening to music and you want to skip whatever song came on you have to pull your phone out of your pocket, which is annoying
You can use just the right one, but to do so you have to connect the left one then put it back in the charger. If you don't you'll be continuously met with a beeping sound as it's trying to pair with the left one. Also, if you try and turn off the left one it will turn off both, so only option is putting it back in its case.

Overall, solid pair of true wireless earbuds with a couple of annoying features, or lack thereof. Nothing incredible, but worth the price.

title: They are worth the money
body: These really are a great pair of earbuds last longer than my Samsung the only problem which really isn't a problem the box was beating up real bad but nothing was messed up Inside the Box I give it a 5-star on all cuz they were so good about a second pair

title: Much cheaper and comfortable alternative!
These work as advertised!
body:
I went on to Amazon to get air buds but saw these buds for 1/3 of the price! After reading the reviews, I decided to take the plunge.
I also had trouble getting the buds to stay in my ear at first, but with the instruction leaflet and a little practice, the buds work great! No issue at all with the quality of the product or the sound quality!

title: Great for the gym-goer.
body:
I have been using wireless headphones at the gym (and for running) for years. However, this is the first time I have had completely cordless headphones... and I am SO happy with the switch. I was concerned with the headphones falling out, but with multiple ear bud sizes included with this set, I was able to get the perfect fit. I'm an audio/video guru of sorts... and the audio is really solid. You may get a little better sound quality from higher end headphones, but these have a great, full sound... good lows. They connect and work like they are supposed to, and they block out most the sound around you. Leaving just a little tiny bit of room for some ambient noise... which is to be desired so we can remain spatially aware when the volume isn't up really high. These are not made for making phone calls (the mic is technically at your ear), but will work just fine if you get a call in the middle of something and don't want to switch to your phone.

I am not a big fan of charging my headphones every couple days, so the protective case acting as a charger is pretty awesome. They clip into their little bays magnetically, which is super satisfying... and the charger lets you know how much juice it still has with some small LED indicators.

I highly recommend these headphones at the price point, and I am very happy with the results I've gotten. If you're not looking to spend at least twice as much, you're going to struggle finding a better pair of wireless/cordless earbuds.

title: Best by Far!
body: This is this first pair of bluetooth headphones that don't hurt my ears or fall out. It was a lot easier to connect to my phone as well. I love that fact that when you take it out if the charging case, it automatically turns on and when you put it in it turns off, I often forget to turn them off. I did notice a little dip in sound quality when walking but when I shifted it slightly it went away. I am recommending to anyone who is looking for bluetooth earbuds.

title: Amazing headphones for the price
body: I bought a different brand of wireless headphones a few months back and was very dissatisfied. They didn't have noise  canceling capabilities and the sound quality was quite bad. However, with these pair, I've been very happy as they have a solid bass as well as great sound quality. The only thing that i'm a little annoyed about is the battery life, but that's only because it's wireless. it's not that big a deal and quite easy to charge however. A really good product!

title: Expected more
body: Expected more . Lots of shssssssss and 20 feet’s away from the phone just stopped connection . Does not fit very well on my years

title: VERY CLEAR SOUND
body: I BOUGHT THIS PRODUCT FIRST, AND I FELT SOMETHING WRONG NOT HAVE CONNECTION IN THE LEFT SIDE, GLADLY , THEY REPLACE IT FOR ME. THE NEW ONE ARRIVED AND BOTH ARE GOOD,I PUT NEW SIZE FOR MY EAR SO WILL NOT POP OUT. GOOD PRODUCT WHEN YOU KNOW HOW TO USE IT RIGHT. THANKS I REALLY HAPPY NOW BY THE PRODUCT.

title: Searched them all- this one's best
body: These are a great value for the sound you get. I researched for a week watching videos and reading reviews. These earbuds have all the latest features you'd find on more expensive ones. The key to getting the most out of the sound is fitting the earbuds to your ears. It comes with 5 different size gel ear-caps so that is easy for any size ears. I'm very pleased with these.

title: Good so far
body: So far these earbuds are great! I love the color, and sound quality. The battery life is very good so far. I also ordered the wireless charger which is also good. The earbuds automatically connect to my phone (Samsung Galaxy S9 Plus) as soon as I take them out of the case.

title: Was skeptical, but pleased
body:
I'm not overly a fan of the kind of headphone that go in your ear like this, but the generous inclusion of four different interchangeable sized ear pieces really gave the option of the most comfortable fit.

I used them in and around the pool and they are still 100% functioning.

Noise cancelation is amazing for me in my loud house and the sound quality isn't metallic at all like I've had with other wireless headphones.

title: Reception
body: I absolutely love this product! I bought 2 sets for me and my guy. He loves them as well. Great choice....the reception is ultra clear! Worth every penny!

title: Great so far!
body: I originally bought a set for my wife to use during gym workouts. She liked the fit and sound. She said they worked well on the treadmill. After my wife told me this I switched from my old wired buds that I use for yard work to these TOZO wireless earbuds. I use them for working on our farm. I have used them for mowing and while using my weed eater. I love the noise cancellation while I’m mowing because I can barely hear my mower while music is playing. I’ve used these while using my chainsaw under my normal earmuff hearing protection. These earbuds work well during all usage conditions so far. I bought the first set for myself about a month ago and so far so good. I bought a third pair for office use. These buds are a great bargain for the sound and fit. I read reviews that said the left earbud cuts out intermittently. I have not experienced this problem. While working I leave my phone on a workbench while I move around and I haven’t experienced any problems. GREAT EARBUDS!!

title: Bad battery life.
body: The sound is great.  They disconnect once in a while. The battery life is 2 1/2 hrs no more than 3. Was going to return them to get the newer model which claims the battery life is 5 hrs. But its too late to return.

title: Defective Battery Case on Multiple Units
body: I have gone through two of these in the last week, both of which were defective.  The first worked completely but when placed on a wireless charger, the bottom-left side of the battery case would become extremely hot (so much so that it made the charging pad overheat as well).  I set up an exchange with Amazon and received my second unit in two days.  That one would not even charge on a wireless charger (though USB charging worked fine).  I tested both of these units on multiple wireless chargers that have charged and continue to charge my phone just fine and reproduced both of their issues.  I intend to replace with a different brand and steer clear of this brand in the future.

title: They work, and work well .
body:
So the first off these worked really well for me. The fit in the ear and come with 6 ear tips to see what works.  The sound quality is good, they are loud and clear. I was shocked they actually staid in my ear with no issue. Its also slim enough charging case .  Also the using it to make calls was really nice, actually was better than my sony cans.

Now my only "issue" which i think would be a great idea to add for the future is a button on the case that shows its current battery level instead of needing to take out one of the buds and putting it back in. Oh and also the cover for the micro usb to charge is a pain to open its in there good.....which is for the water resistance but still.  People were talking about issues with it cutting out, I only experienced it one time but after that its hasn't happened since .

I would love it if a future incarnation had the ability to access google assistant but for the price, I think it $40 when i got them on sale I'm not arguing .

All together these are great for when im on the bus to work, working out, or mowing the lawn. So far has been worth it.

title: Best earbuds out there!
body: Love the wireless earbuds! Super easy to set up, use, charge & use! Best ones I've used! Charging is fast, easy and can recharge in case, absolutely love these!! The case is study and will last!

title: Actually, pretty impressive
body: After being a die-hard, no frills runner for the past 45 years, never worn any type of headset, decided to try them out after reading about different types in a recent national running magazine.  These weren't included in the article but found them when researching across the internet and Amazon.  Can't beat the price = value, overall fit is perfect, easy set up to my iPhone, simple to use, and hence my headline of 'impressive'.  Only had them a week, will check back after a few months of daily use and onset of winter months on the horizon.

title: Good earbuds!
body: I have been using these earbuds for about a month now, and I am happy with them. The sound is crisp and clear, they block enough outside noise that I have to remove a bud if someone wants to talk to me, and they were easy to pair. The one small thing I note is that the right bud, for me, doesn't fit perfectly, and feels like it's slightly loose. I have had luck turning it towards my face and it seems to fit better. The buds otherwise fit securely and I'm not worried about them falling out, even while running, stair runs, and jumping jacks. I use them about 2.5 hours per week on one charge, and they have never run out of juice.

title: Battery life is shitty, don't be fooled by the good reviews
body: Sound quality is excellent. However, battery only stays charged for 1-2 hours at a time (very disappointing! I've gotten worse quality overall headphones that at least  stayed charged for 5-6 hrs) and the earbuds fall out of my ears if I'm not sitting completely still and don't move at all. I have the smallest of the ""comfort"" tips in (my ears are irritated from having to re-shove them in every five minutes, though I should say I've had this problem with other headphone manufacturers of this type), no dice. Just not practical for me, but I desperately need headphones--any headphones--so I won't be returning them.

title: Finally, found ear buds that can keep up with me on MTB trail
body: I was about to pay for powerbeats pro, thinking i needed to pay serious money for something that actually works. I've been through so many ear buds and blue tooth devices but decided to try this last product before i did since the PBP are a little too bulky for me. Not only are these comfortable / feel good in they also withstood one of my longer rides where my sweat didn't kill them. I'm sold and recommend these to anyone. Battery lasts a long time and charging case charges via wireless device with up to 4 full charges for the buds.

title: Worked great until it didn't
body: Worked great for a little over 4 months but then get quiet and continually disconnects or fades in and out. Unsure why as they worked great before and have had no physical damage.

title: Work for a month and then die?
body: So this product lasts until just past the return window. Convenient. They worked perfectly fine for a month. Then over the last week have not held a charge and there is zero way to contact about this. The support is only for setting up. But they simple pretty peices of plastic and wires now. No matter how long I charge them plugged in or on the base. They work for 10 mins and then blink low and turn off almost instantly. Would be nice if I could get a replacement or just a refund so I can try a different brand. This. Sucks.

title: The high number of good reviews seem warranted so far
body:
Disclaimer:
- I'm not an audiophile. My main use case for these earbuds is listening to podcasts.
- It seems like TOZO will offer to send you a free wireless charger for the case if you activate the warranty. In the email, they'll encourage you to write a review so that's my primary reason for writing a review.

Pros:
- One year warranty. TOZO is very upfront about their warranty (they include a small card with a QR code for activation in the box) which is a good sign for the service. I've owned three wireless earbuds so far (1 had poor audio quality out of the box, 1 broke after a year and a half, and I lost the case for the other), so it's reassuring to have this warranty.
- Good fit. TOZO includes several different ear tips in the box (there were 3 additional pairs in mine though one pair did not look like the rest of them and didn't really fit the earbuds so I wonder if that was a packaging mistake). The standard ones did not fit me well, but the bigger ones did so I am thankful they included the different ear tips.
- Sound quality is solid. The podcasts I listen to sound great on these earbuds. After listening to some music on these earbuds, I would say that the sound quality does seem a little lacking. For $50 though, I think the sound quality definitely acceptable.
- Case seems to have good build quality. It just seems like a nice and sturdy case. The lid doesn't snap open/close in a way that makes me feel like it'll break earlier than expected. Also nice is that there's four lights that indicate the amount of charge left in the case.

Cons:
- There's a disconnection lag. The earbuds will connect automatically and fairly quickly to my phone when I pull them out of the case. When I put them into the case though, there's a 6-7 second lag before they finally disconnect from my phone which is a bit odd.
- Case is kind of bulky. It's a little taller and wider than three quarters in a row so it's definitely one of the bulkier cases I've seen. Also another minor note on the case is that there's a cover on the charging port that is a bit to take off at first.
- There's a lot of voice lines during connection. This is more of a minor annoyance but the amount of "Power on", "Connected", "Second Device", "Left channel", "Right channel" voices when you put them on is excessive. A simple "left connected", "right connected" would be sufficient.
- There's red accents on the earbuds. This is another minor complaint but why add red to something that is completely black? I should've noticed because you can see it in the product pictures, but it does make me wish I considered buying the white earbuds.

Other Notes:
- They claim that the earbuds + case can last a 12.5 hours which isn't super impressive but should be fine for my purposes since I will typically never use them for more than an hour at a time.
- Waterproof functionality is cool. Haven't had a chance to see this in action.
- Wireless charging is nice considering how hard the cover for the charging port is to take off at first.
- Customer service is promising so far (the warranty and free wireless charger are good signs).

title: Waste of money.
body: Half the time these things don't actually charge when they're in the case. Battery life indicators are never accurate. They'll turn on by themselves and pair with your phone when you're in the middle of a b phone call. Waste of money. OH and these stopped working completely the day after the return window closed.

title: Outdoors or Indoors - great product
body: I've only used this product a few days, but I love the ease of charging, the comfort, and the sound.  The sound is very close to listening to a Bose stereo with headsets on!  Charging is easing with the wireless case, and the charge lasts for hours! I really hope the earbuds last a long time, because I'm really loving them right now🤞

title: All the features you want, BEST product!
body:
These are fantastic. I purchased these for wearing in the evening when I'm doing my skincare routine, so I can listen to podcasts after my husband has already gone to sleep. I needed something that wouldn't get in the way with wires/cords - even the kind that are "wireless" but are connected with a loop that goes around behind your head wouldn't work for me, because I apply all my skincare products to the back of my neck too! Don't neglect your neck, ladies! ;-) So I needed something that would allow true freedom of movement and not interfere in any way, but that would also STAY PUT in my ears. These definitely do that. It's great that they come with different sizes to custom fit your ear - I have small ears, and the smallest size is perfect for me! Very comfortable, and they stay put throughout my whole routine, even in pulling my headband on/off past my ears over my head.

The sound quality is great on these, just as good as my Apple earbuds if not better! I'm no audiophile, but even I recognized that it was noticeably clearer and smoother. The noise cancellation is also very good - not so over the top that I'm deaf to the rest of the world and oblivious if anything important happens and I am needed, but just right so that I hear what I'm listening to perfectly without other noise competition.

The bluetooth connection is incredibly fast and, after the first time of going into my phone and selecting these in the bluetooth menu, it automatically connected every time after that without me having to select them in the menu. Love that little extra feature. I just pop these out of their case, and they connect immediately, almost before I even have them in my ears!

Also I should mention the case - there were some other truly wireless earbuds I was considering (SoundPEATS brand), but the "case" they came in was open on the top, no cover. I know they're waterproof enough for swimming, showeing, etc., and I use them nightly so they aren't just sitting around literally "collecting dust," but call me crazy - I like for my electronics to be protected. So I like that the case for these is ACTUALLY a case with a COVER. But I LOVE that it's translucent enough that you can see the battery light indicators at a glance!

In full disclosure, I will say the company emailed me AFTER I purchased these with my own money to ask that I review them, and offered to send me a complementary wireless charging base in return. However, they specified it should be an HONEST review, which it is! And I was so impressed with these I was already planning on reviewing them in the first place, so their offer was just a nice added bonus. These are a great pair of wireless earbuds all around, well worth the price, and with great performance. I will be purchasing another pair for my husband, and probably some more as Christmas gifts. HIGHLY recommend!!

title: Excellent sound using a chainsaw
body: I use them while working in the woods using a chain saw. They have superb quality sound, fit very well, and small enough to allow my ear muffs to fit over without interference.

title: Better than the other reviewers say!
body: These things are great!  Lots of bass, fit good, and mine lasted over 3 hours and 50 minutes on one charge!  They can be turned up so loud that they will blow your eardrums out.  I like loud music, but I can’t turn them up more than a little over half way before they are busting my head open!  I read a lot of the other reviews and was kind of skeptical, but after trying these I would have paid more for them.  Other people were saying that they kept losing connection, but even after almost 4 hours on one charge they still sounded amazing and did not cut out even once.  Charging time from the battery dock from completely dead to full charge was exactly one hour.  I am extremely pleased with these.

title: Buyer beware
body: Bluetooth connection is horrible.  It is slow and awkward to connect.  Left one looses connection if it connects at all.  Do not believe theses reviews.  Spend your money elsewhere.

title: EXCELLENT COST BENEFIT!!
body:
I purchased the earbuds about a month ago and so far I'm EXTREMELY satisfied with it.
Packaging is very well structured and protective, it brings the wireless charging case, a pair of earbuds themselves, four pairs of ear caps at different sizes and also a plug in charger and cable - besides a FREE 1 Yr EXTENDED WARRANTY card (that must be activated), a "quick tips" sheet and manual for complete instructions in 6 languages (EN, JP, DE, SP, IT, FR).
Extremely easy and quick to connect!!
Very PRACTICAL!! After first use, the earbuds turn on BY THEMSELVES once you remove them from the case.
Microphone works very well - never had complains from the person at the other side of the PHONE CALL nor heard s/he breaking up. You can answer or reject calls and even redial last number by click pressing the earbuds.
The sound quality is great, I always use them while EXERCISING and... it's really COMFORTABLE not having to remove them to take a shower as they're WATER PROOF!! You can play or pause songs by click pressing them too.
I never had an Apple or Samsung wireless earbud, which costs no less than $100-$150 but honestly DO NOT NEED IT AT ALL as my TOZO T10 earbuds DOES A GREAT JOB!! And... the BEST OF ALL, you can have them for a GREAT PRICE!!

title: Worth the price
body: These are worth the price. I’d buy them again. The sound is not super consistent; almost like it changes back and forth from stereo to mono. And I don’t really notice great bass. The battery lasted about 2 hours or so before I got the low battery notification. I haven’t had them long so I don’t know how durable they are, and I haven’t tested the water proof quality. I’ve been able to move a couple rooms away from my phone before they start to cut out. I really like that they come with changeable earbud sizes! They’re pretty comfortable. I haven’t exercised with them yet, but they feel like they’ll probably stay put.

title: Quality wireless earbuds
body: This makes the 3rd pair of wireless earbuds I've purchased  and the TOZO T10 earbuds have met my expectations so far. The sound quality is surprisingly impressive, especially the bass. My wife used to complain about not hearing me clearly while on the phone in the  in the two previous brand earbuds I purchased. But while wearing the TOZO T10 earbuds, my wife understands me clearly. The shape of the earbuds fit securely in my ear with out fear of them falling out. It comes with four different options of ear tips to choose from.  The case charger doesn't look as good as other cases but they make up for with quality ear buds . TOZO customer sevice sent me an email twice to ensure that I'm happy with the product.

title: Great product, incredible sound
body: Like others have mentioned, Airpods are not for everyone. I was in search of a pair of truly wireless ear buds that fit my ears, and Tozo delivered. These ear buds are have a great form factor; small, but not too small where you lose them. The case is really nice too  – sturdy, easy to open (which was a big one for me) and the magnetic charging pieces are great. For me, personally, these fit perfect in my ear. The sound on these is also incredible. Tons of deep base, great highs, great mids... when they are in, the sounds is amazing. You'd think you're wearing a $200 pair of ear buds. My only issue with these is with movement, such as gym or fitness activity. They sound gets spotty and cuts in and out, which is the problem with almost every ear bud on the market that doesn't utilize the Apple W1 chip for connection. Overall, these are a great value in almost all applications other than aggressive fitness/physical activity.

title: Buy these instead of air pods
body: I honestly wasn’t expecting much out of these headphones but the sound quality surpasses that of my beats ear buds. Especially the bass i was pleasantly surprised. The noise cancelation is also excellent if that is what you’re looking for. Battery life seems to be good as well. I haven’t had any connection issues with these as other users have claimed, I usually keep my phone in my pocket and so far great quality. Definitely a good buy for the price.

title: A Great Find - Great sound quality and waterproof and inexp
body:
I love these earbuds and now have a second pair. Support took care of me and fixed my problem.

I originally ordered these as a test for swimming and use of my iPhone as a Bluetooth music source as I did laps in the pool. Wow have I been impressed. Great sound quality, and I can do laps in the pool while my phone sits in the bleachers with only an very occasional sound glitch.  AND great sound to boot … awesome … Makes my laps much more enjoyable.

Best $40 I’ve spent in years.

Update: I crushed one of the earbuds by mistake. Just received my second set - well worth it.

title: Sound is good, mic is iffy
body: These are fairly good for the price! Sound quality is great, and noise cancellation is pretty good, but I do have an issue with the microphone. It seems to quiet down my voice in some apps I use to talk with people. Other than that, these are pretty good! Which the battery life was a little longer, but you don’t really see improvement in that area until you get to earbuds around quadruple the price

title: It’s a good price for a decent pair of ear buds.
body: I honestly had high hopes with all the other reviews and the pricing. Unfortunately, it just wasn’t the sound quality I was hoping for, and also the fitting in my ear never felt comfortable. Each time I place the right earbud in my ear it sounded as if the speaker was damaged, making a sound that was similar to crinkling a small plastic candy wrapper.

title: Look good.  Sound better.
body: Work great but was a little disappointed with the 2hr battery life. They stay in well but for extended yard work projects have to stick to the wired kind.

title: Pretty crap.
body: These headphones are utter garbage, they would cut off randomly while I was working out from the first day they arrived. After 5 months, one of the buds just made this awful noise and broke completely. Maybe I'm picky, but I expect my headphones to last longer than 5 months.

title: Great Unit For the Right Application
body: Sound and fit was really great.  These earbuds are great for walking or driving; but as soon as I started exercising vigorously and sweating during workouts (like workouts on elliptical), they pop out of my ears.  If they added a simple ear loop to the unit, that would take care of the issue of popping out.  I even took a call in the shower with unit in my ear and it worked perfect.  I'll will use it as a hands-free blue-tooth to answer calls while walking or driving, but I have to use a different ear bud for workouts.

title: Comfort and Wireless Charging
body: These are very comfortable to wear. Features are comparable to top ear-buds from big names. Water-proof and wireless charging are useful. I tried the Galaxy Buds previously, and I prefer these for fit as well as call quality.

title: nice wireless earbuds
body: I like these a lot. they are comfortable and have great sound quality. Just have one minor gripe with it. When i first opened them and pulled out the right ear bud, it didn't register that i pulled it out so it never tried to connect to the left or find the phone. I had to put it back in and pull it out again to fix it. This happened one other time, but hasn't happened since. Only other thing is I do wish the case could hold more of a charge, but that isn't anything big at all.

title: Nice bass!!!
body:
I read a few reviews to see what I liked and didn't like about Bluetooth ear buds.  Even though the case doesn't charge my phone, I love these ear buds!!
Great: the Sound quality, it has a bass booster, and I adjusted my phone's equalizer, now it has even better-highs and lows, vocals, nice balance; Buds instead of dangling from my ears; Quick charge; Instant pairing, Easy calls.
Not so great: Very snug fit with smallest buds, didn't like putting them in with pressure inside ear canal. But I pull my ear lobes down and its much better putting them in.
I've got about 5 hours so far listening to music  in first 24 hours of receiving these.  Great ear buds!!

title: Awesome sound for a budget price
body: I have tried several budget priced earbuds just to be disappointed. I was at the Bose store and tried theirs on that run $199 a pair. They sounded outstanding but out of my price range. Then I seen these TOZO's in several reviews and decided to try them out. I tell you they sound so close to the Bose one's I tried for a quarter of the price. I have had mine now for a couple weeks and I'm so impressed that I've been telling all my friends about them. Thanks TOZO for putting a product out there that is affordable and still have outstanding sound.

title: Great all-purpose earbuds
body:
I was skeptical about how securely these earbuds would stay in my ears. I did have to change the little pads but they stay perfectly, even when my ears got sweaty from running around in the desert heat.

I've used these for listening to music, podcasts, and making hands-free calls on the go. The sound quality is clear and balanced. And I love the wireless charging case for safe storage.

I am very happy with this product.

title: Excellent.
body: These a pretty great! I think sound quality is good, range is decent, and battery life is amazing. I do have to return the buds to the charging pack if I turn them off manually to get them to reconnect to my phone and on occasion one bud will cut out momentarily but this does not bother me much. Besides that, they’re not the most suitable for my ears as I’ve noticed when working out and building up a sweat they are fairly prone to falling out. However, walking, doing chores, and staying up right in general I have little to no issues.

title: Good sound, comfortable, but no music controls
body:
Bought these earbuds to replace a pair that was dying. I was looking for something with Bluetooth 5.0 connectivity, as well as not having a wire between the 2 earbuds, and this fit the bill, had good reviews, and was a reasonable price.

My expectations have been met. The earbuds were easy to setup out of the box, the instructions were clear, and the packaging was professional. (plus half star)

I use these mainly when I'm out jogging. The first time I wore them, I could barely feel them, they were comfortable and stayed put well. The second time I wore them, I noticed they were moving around a little more, and I had to constantly re-adjust them to get them to stay in. They do come with 4 different size ear tips, so I will try a different size for next time, and see if that works out a little better.

Each time I went out, I had them on for about 50 minutes, and didn't run into any low battery issues.

At one point, my wife and I decided to each wear one, so we could listen to the same song. She was on the right side of the sidewalk, with the right earbud, I was on the left with the left, and I noticed the left earbud was cutting out a bit. When we switched sides, so the 2 earbuds were closer to each other, the issue stopped happening. (minus half star)

Also, the buttons on either earbud will allow you to control calls (answer/hang up), or pause/unpause music. However, you can't use the buttons to advance/rewind music, or adjust volume. These are features that would have been nice to have. Particularly since each earbud has a button, it would have been nice if they each performed a different function (right side for answer/hangup/pause/unpause, left for fast forward?). (Minus 1 star)

I haven't received a call yet while wearing these, so I don't know what the voice quality is, and whether the person I'm talking to will be able to hear me or not.

Total 4 stars.

title: Good purchase!
body:
These headphones are pretty good! The sound quality is surprisingly good. They cancel out outside noise really well and they stay in my ears just fine when running or lifting weights. A lot of complaints on not fitting right but if you twist slightly while putting in your ear it fits snuggly,  mine came with 3 different sizes and i had to use the smallest. The sound does cut out sometimes when im lifting weights but not as bad as some reviews make it out... when just sitting at work the sound is 100% and does not cut out.

Battery life is decent. Will last 3-4 hours on 1 charge and fully charges within 30 mins.

I would purchase them again. The case is kind of big, but otherwise a solid product

title: These are Fine Ear Buds
body: Easy to use and self starting and pairing after first pair. Several adapters for ear canal. Overall very satisfied

title: Incredible sound quality and built quality, highly recommended!
body:
The last time I bought a wireless headphone is last year with a Bose Quiet Comfort II. Owning another two wireless headphones from Taoelectronics in addition to the Bose, I do not have much expectation for this pair of tiny earbuds, but I was blown out of the water when first putting them on. The sound quality is vibrant and deep, and very comfortable, does not feel heavy at all.

I read many reviews before buying that mentioned about the lack of bass, which I found the complete opposite as these earbuds are kickin' hard, in which I have to turn down the volume. Technology has advanced so much in the past few years, and these earbuds surpass my Taoelectronics headphones (Vava Moov 25) in 2014 by a mile.

I usually do not care much about the box presentation, but the company Tozo paid attention to their packaging. Outside is a clear plastic cover and the box construction is solid and well-made. I cannot justify spending more than $150 for a pair of Apple Airpods with a worse water-proof rating and sound quality.

The battery case is very well made and sturdy, the earbuds themselves are well made and completely sealed off so I will test using them under the rainy weather while working out. I hesitated to invest $40 in these earbuds, but this turns out to be the best upgrades ever. I will sure use these earbuds as much as my Bose QuietComfort II.

title: Expectations exceeded
body: These are LOUD..and I like loud music. The bass is heavy and the sound is clear. No issues pairing..both ears sound even. This is my first pair of earpods.  I put them in and did not want to take them out.  I might actually become one of those people that always has their pods in. I cant wait until my flight to see how they really perform.

title: Great Headphones1
body: First off, the headphones seem very durable. I’ve dropped them a few times and used them in rain and they held up well. The sound quality was a lot better than I was expecting and the bass is deep and not distorted. The range of the headphones from the device you are using does not reach as far as I would like, and the individual headphones need to be close together or they cut out bad. The only complaint I have is that the LED lights in the headphones do not turn off once they are paired and they continuously blink during use. While using the headphones at night it lights up the whole room and disturbs anyone else that is in there. I wish the led lights would only blink if the battery was low or if they weren’t paired.

title: Run 3 miles and I have to constantly push them in
body: I bought these because when I run my chord was getting annoying on my workout headphones. At first I was totally blown away at the quality and great sounds of the music. I do experience a clicking sound every so often where my music is interrupted as if the headphones are experiencing issues with bluetooth, but it is minimal and quickly recovers. Also, I run 3 miles regularly and no slower than an 8 minute mile, and I have to constantly push these in so they do not fall out. I have small ears and have the smallest connectors on, but I will try a size up and see if it makes a difference. So far I am not disappointed, but I do not know any better yet.

title: Bit of a learning curve, but great overall!
body:
I picked these up as a way to avoid bugging my housemates when listening to music and podcasts in the shower, and they work really well for that purpose! These are supposed to be waterproof, and thus far, this is proving to be true, although I should mention that I don't keep my head under the water the entire time I'm in. The charger/case is small and fits easily in my purse, and I like that it came with a little cord should I choose to wear the case instead. They also block sound fairly well and the sound quality itself is comparable with other headphones I use and enjoy. The case also seems to charge quite efficiently, and as long as I turn the buds off before replacing them, I don't have to charge the case very often - I only charge it maybe once every 1.5-2 weeks or so, and that's with daily use.

My only real complaints with the headphones are that 1) I can't seem to select buds that *perfectly* fit and stay in my ears, 2) it took me a couple days to realize that I should be actively shutting the buds off before putting them back in their case/charger,  3) they seem to want to shift a bit if I'm moving my jaw too much, and 4) the Bluetooth connection can be a touch finicky. The first issue is relatively minor, the second is on me because I should have read the manual more carefully (though it was a pain to put them in there and realize a couple days later that they were dead and so was the case), the third is on me because my jaw pops and moves more than it probably should. The connection issue is a bit of a pain, but is manageable; it took me some time to recognize how to best help the connection along by ensuring that my phone is thoughtfully placed in my pocket, or to make sure I'm not blocking the right-side bud too much. If you hold that bud in your hand (like clench it in your fist), the connection will cut out. If I lay down and have the right side of my head resting on my arm, the connection will cut out. However, I can also wander all around my decently-sized apartment without too much issue in terms of connection, regardless of whether my phone is on me, so this isn't a particularly major problem.

Ultimately, I really like these headphones, and they're working great for me for what I need from them. It took a week or so of consistent use to learn their idiosyncrasies, but now that I've got those down, they work perfectly fine for me. If you're okay with a slight learning curve, this is a solid choice of product!

title: Best Wireless Earbuds To Date
body: I have purchased several wireless earbuds over the past few years. The TOZO T10 TWS Bluetooth 5.0 Earbuds are by far the best ones i have owned. My older ones were bulky and stuck out of my ears too much, the max volume was not that loud and the battery would barely last me to the end of my gym sessions. That is not the case with these! Volume is loud and the sound is clear at that. They are extremely low profile and the battery lasts... ive gone 2 and 3 full gym sessions on one charge. The case is cool looking as well and easily connects to the buds to charge. Very satisfied with the product.

title: Great Sounds Quality, Affordable Price
body: These wireless buds have amazing sound quality!! I've owned the other big brand and these are comparable, it's impressive!! They're easy to setup right out of the box. They come with a free 1 year extended warranty, and customer service is already excellent. I anticipate enjoying these earbuds for a long time.

title: Great Fix to my IPhone Problem
body:
Ok so I have an iPhone and was so done with having one pair of earbuds for my computer and another for my iPhone and decided on these:

Pros: Fantastic bass, quick and easy pairing, fast charging, waterproof, stay in, long range, very attractive in ear look (not odd looking like AirPods which is why I was looking for other brands, yes I’m vain)

Cons: I wish that a double click on the side of the buds was a “next song” button and not a “redial” button but it doesn’t change anything honestly, just a possible improvement.

title: GREAT TRULY WIRELESS EARBUDS
body: These are a decent pair of truly wireless earbuds for the price. Noise cancellation isn't the best. I could still hear sounds around me but I'm ok with that.  I use them on my Galaxy S8 and music sounds pretty nice especially if you can adjust the music EQ. Bass sounds good and sounds are clear and crisp. I used them in the shower and they worked fine. Even after getting them soaked. I do think if any moisture gets on the silicone piece that goes in your ear they could slip out. I'm sure if you have the right fitting silicone bud it could avoid this issue. It comes with extra silicone buds. But when dry you can run and jump in them and they'll stay in. Every now and then I feel like there is a frequency issue because sometimes the left bud will go in and out but not always. It's enough that I wouldn't mind putting up with it.
